**and on Twitter**
**[http://www.twitter.com/KenEvents/](http://www.twitter.com/KenEvents/)**
**[Also Click Here for more information including the Ken's Events disclaimer.](https://www.meetup.com/KENS-EVENTS-EXPLORE-LONDON-SECRETS/pages/14591782/KEN%27S_EVENTS_DISCLAIMER)**

name: South Bucks Social
description:
Hi and Welcome to the wonderful world of South Bucks Social Club aka SBS. We are a very friendly & inclusive bunch, who enjoy everything from pub quiz's, to walks, to meals, to music, to cinema, to talks, to theatre events and everything in between, in and around the South Bucks area. But we are not a singles or dating group.
The club is run by Brian, Dawn & Mary, plus has a whole bunch of wonderful Event Hosts, hosting a wide variety of events. 
We do charge a small subscription fee of £5.00 per year, however we do not charge a "per event" attendance fee. We are a non profit organisation and all subscription fees goes to cover the cost of using the Meetup web platform.
We look forward to welcoming you to one of the many SBS events soon!
All the very best, 
Brian, Dawn, Mary and all at SBS :)

name: Female Friends in SE London 35+
description:
This is a female only group for 35+ women in SE London (Crystal Palace, Dulwich, Peckham)

Hi everyone,

I started this group to meet new people and hopefully make new friends! Join me if you enjoy coffee, picnics, cinema, dog walks, live music…

See you soon :)

name: Shy Bis & Gay Guys
description:
Welcome to **Shy Bis & Gay Guys**!
(formerly "Shy Gay and Bi Men")
A group for Gay, bi men who would like to meet others that do not always find it easy socialising and meeting new people.

===
INTRODUCTION

Shyness and social anxiety can hold guys back from forming meaningful platonic and romantic relationships. It can be tough enough ‘coming out’, but being introverted can make it even more of a challenge and sometimes you need a gentle push.

So, whether you consider yourself to be ‘gay’, ‘bi’, ‘bi-curious’, ‘pansexual’ or any other label; whether you are ‘in the closet’, ‘out’ or in the process of ‘coming out’; whether you are vulnerable or feel at risk, this group brings us together. We embrace those who have experienced depression, anxiety, loneliness or isolation, especially if you may be considered on the spectrums of ADHD, Autism & Asperger’s, Bipolar, OCD and/or Schizophrenia.

You may be a highly sensitive person who experiences intense highs and lows to an extreme degree. You may be an artistic Creative with a vivid inner world hidden and locked away. You may feel easily overwhelmed by large groups of people, unsettled by the turbulence of the LGBTQ+ dating scene or sidelined/neglected in a whirlwind of rapidly spinning social circles. Anxiety may have even prevented you from moving forwards in friendships and relationships with other people because you are afraid of either hurting or getting hurt. This Meetup group is designed for you!

Have you ever taken years to build up the confidence to attend an event only to be disappointed? Want to attend an LGBTQ+ event but held back by your shyness? Simply come as you are. There is no need to pretend anymore. This is a get together for people who do not want to be alone, to feel comfortable, and foster a nice, friendly circle of people. And if you would like to attend but do not feel like talking much, then that is cool, too! Take it at your own pace.

===
DETAILS

This free group is for friendship and dating, designed to reach out to others and create mutual support. The concept is simple: helping one another get out there in the world. Some meet-ups are limited to 6 or 12 places so that it is not too overwhelming for new members. I will provide my contact details 24 hours before each event either in a group e-mail or in a private message. Do feel free to get in touch if you would like to have a chat about the event before you attend!

I do not charge fees for attending our meet-ups. All I ask is that a one-off discretionary donation is made for your first time. This is to help cover the cost of running the group. Meetup groups are not free to run and cost £180 over the course of a year. I have put a link below (Paypal) where you give a one-off donation of £10 (or any amount) to help out. The group will always remain free so there is no obligation but it would be greatly appreciated. The link works on both desktops and smartphones.

[paypal.me/roryduffy27 ](paypal.me/roryduffy27 )

Facebook:
[https://www.facebook.com/groups/shybisandgayguys](https://www.facebook.com/groups/shybisandgayguys)

name: Female Friends - London (20-45yrs)
description:
Welcome to our community! This group is made for ladies who want to make new female friends in London in a relaxed environment. We hope you will make lifelong girlfriends here, as well as enjoy all the fun London has to offer. There will be several events each month ranging from brunch, theatre, days out and much more! Suggestions for events are welcomed and encouraged. We encourage new people to attend, so feel free to RSVP to events that take you interest! 👩🏿‍🤝‍👩🏼❤️

<br>


Our Ethos -

We want everyone to contribute to the success and joy of this group, and this involves turning up to the events you RSVP to. Showing up is a commitment we want everyone to make, as this helps the organisers maximise the spaces booked, helps the attendees meet more new people, and most importantly it help you fulfil the commitment you made to yourself to meet nice new friends.


WE STRICTLY DO NOT DO ANY NETWORING OR ANY BUSINESS-RELATED EVENTS OF ANY KIND, NO EXCEPTIONS. This group is for meaningful friendships and quality time amongst women in London.


NO-SHOW POLICY – We would like to maximise every event for your full enjoyment, therefore we encourage you to turn up to the events you RSVP to. All attendance is monitored. TWO missed events will be marked as 'no-shows', and a polite reminder will be sent to you. If you do not show up THREE times when you have RSVP'd as "Yes" without sending a message and changing your RSVP, you will be automatically removed from the group. Its important you RSVP to things you can attend to, and change you RSVP in good time if other plans come up. Please do this so we can offer your spot to someone else if you decide not to attend. This rule applies to last minute drop outs (UNDER 48hrs) without a message too. This is to make sure that we maximise all the space we book for events and include more people who want to participate and enjoy meeting each other.

<br>

PAYMENT - Please note, running this group is not free and lead organisers pay Meet-up a monthly fee to keep the group running. Therefore RSVPs will be charged a non-refundable £3 for all events. Some events might also require an additional fee if the restaurant or event venue requires a prepayment. This £3 is non-refundable under all circumstances unless only if the organisers cancel the event. If you cancel your RSVP the non-refund still applies. If you would like to support the continued running of this group you can also donate any amount to our PayPal pool which I can send to you if you request the link :)

<br>

WAITLIST - Please be aware that we currently don't have waitlist and all events are first come first serve. Updates will be sent out once we can have a functioning waitlist.

<br>

SAFETY AND COURTESY: We want everyone to have a fun and safe time when attending our events, and we want our organisers to communicate with attendees about event updates with confidence that they will be treated with respect - therefore we follow Meet-up's policy on safety strictly. We do not tolerate any abusive language towards anyone in this group. Please DM people with respect. Any members found to be harassing/insulting/threatening/bullying any member of this group will be removed immediately and the ban will be permanent. We also make reports to meet-up who have the power to remove any policy breakers of the platform completely.


SOCIAL MEDIA: Our Instagram handle is @femalefriendsLDN. Please follow. We take pictures at events. If you do not want your picture uploaded please let the organiser know and they will delete all pictures featuring you.

name: Single-and-Social-London - Over 35 Singles Parties.
description:
Every friend or partner started with the first hello!

We aim to provide a safe environment for you to make new friends and widen your social circle. We know how daunting it is for ladies to come alone to events so we can even put ladies coming alone in touch with each other beforehand. We'd like to offer this to you too guys but we know how strange you would think it was if we said we could network you with other men beforehand lol! We can only suggest that you arrive at the start of the event when we can properly introduce you into a mixed group of new arrivals and ease you in gently. 

We have members from mainly 30 but we don't mind younger or older. We have big numbers at our events when we are able to hold them so there will still be plenty of people within your age range. 

If you wish to book for any of the events please text Julie Davies on 07809 709099 with full name and email stating the date of the event. Please note that RSVP only does not book you.

Obviously we cannot hold any actual live events until social distancing comes to an end. Meanwhile, if anyone reading this would like to organise a Zoom meeting free of charge online for this group please let me know. I can make you an organise on both of my Meet Up groups and you could help many of our single members through this lock down if they are living alone.

name: Bermondsey Boulders
description:
Ever wanted to try bouldering/indoor wall climbing? It is an exciting and fun way to stay fit: it is challenging, both physically and mentally, and a great way to exercise! I remember walking pass the Arch at Bermondsey and wondering “where on earth are those people walking to, especially with those funny shoes hanging from their backpacks” before I knew it I was one of those people! lol

I plan to have weekly bouldering Meet-ups for people who are curious about bouldering or like bouldering and want to have some good company and vibes while at it. We can cheer each other on and work on problems together!

All levels are welcome! Even if you are a complete beginner, though kindly please watch the safety intro video ([The Arch Climbing Wall - Safety Intro ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vBTStDqP_9c)) and fill out the [register online form here ](https://signups.archclimbingwall.com/)\- please make sure to watch the video all the way through as there is important info in it that you’ll be asked a few questions about on your very first visit to the Arch centre\. Nevertheless\, you will have your fellow Bermondsey Boulders to support you on your very first climb and future climbs :\-\)

I am sure the intermediate and advance climbers will be happy to share some tips when you attend, I know I will need it lol. Let’s get to know each other and help each other out to make this group a positive and fulfilling experience for everyone.

Twice a week, from 6:30pm on Wednesday and 11:00am on Sundays we will be meeting at the Surrey Quays Arch & Bermondsey Arch. Let us enjoy bouldering together. The entrance is within the biscuit factory compound that also has the PureGym Bermondsey branch. For the Surrey Quays centre, you can't miss it just go to the Shopping centre entrance and it will be on your left.

All you need to bring are a comfortable change of clothes that are easy to move in. The Arch provides lockers to keep your personal belongings safe as well.

The Surrey Quays branch is now completed this new Rotherhithe SE16 branch is located in the heart of the biggest Shopping Complex in the Borough, so cool right? And do not worry, it is literally the same distance you will travel from Bermondsey Station to Arch one. 

After the Sunday session, let us have lunch together at the famous Bermondsey Maltby Street Market..it is a 15 minute walk from the Arch.…. They have a good variety of cooked food to buy.. yum!

This event is completely free to attend, and the only costs you have to bear are the Arch fees and/or shoe rental.

Indoor bouldering is safe (if you follow the guidelines) and offers a great workout, no matter what your age! So if you have ever been curious about the sport of bouldering, or wanting to get back into it with some company this group is a great place to start in what I hope will be a safe and friendly atmosphere for you. Check out some of our session's highlights here - https://www.meetup.com/bermondsey-boulders/photos/

The bouldering sessions will be taking place in the Arch centres (bouldering only) in SE16. These are located in the neighbouring districts of Bermondsey and Rotherhithe (Southwark is so bless)

If you have any questions, feel free to DM me! Let’s enjoy bouldering together and make new friends along the way !

[Event Summary]

Locations: Arch Climbing Wall: Building One, Bermondsey SE16 (10min from Bermondsey Station)
                  Arch Climbing Wall, Surrey Quays, Rotherhithe SE16 (10min from Canada Water Station & Surrey Quays Overground Station)

Date & Time: Twice a week,
6:30pm - 9:30pm (Can join and leave anytime, Wednesdays)
                                             11:00am - 13:00pm (Lunch afterwards at Maltby Street Market, Sundays)

Level: Beginners are welcome! (Experienced climbers can share tips)

Event Fee: Free (You only pay for the Arch entrance fee)

Equipment: Nothing (you can rent shoes and chalk at the gym or buy your own)

Extra: Students and certain key workers can bring their ID for discount !

\*\*\*\*\*\*
Bouldering meetup is for 18 years and above.

Pictures may be taken on the days for the group page.

Three unexplained no-shows will be removed from group

Please provide an actual photo of yourself and at least your first name

name: London Board Games
description:
Welcome to London Board Games

The purpose of this group could not be easier... To help bring people together to play board games across London.

The main difference between this Meetup and some others is that you are very much encouraged to come with your own suggestions for venues, dates and times for game sessions. This Meetup will then allow you to host and organise it. If you'd like to host an event, simply write that in the discussion and you will be made an event organiser.

There are no rules on which games you can or cannot play. This is simply up to the group to decide, perhaps in advance by making the event a game-specific event, or by mutual agreement.

Please do join and let's start organising more board game sessions all across London!

For example, perhaps you have a local gaming cafe but no-one to play with, then simply post a date and time and a limit of how many players the game(s) you want to play suits and see if anyone signs up. The more we do that, the bigger this group will grow.

name: Speed Dating Meetup
description:
We are Speeddater.co.uk and this is our another official group on Meetup.com.

We have a 18 years of experience in organising dating events. We are proud to offer a great range of events from speed dating to special masterclasses and huge parties. Join us today and start dating!

We also have other special groups on Meet up:

For speed dating and parties in London: https://www.meetup.com/london-dating-group/

For gay speed dating events: https://www.meetup.com/London-Gay-Singles-Meetup-Group/

For lesbian speed dating events: https://www.meetup.com/London-Lesbian-Dating-Meetup-Group/

For speed dating and parties in all the UK cities: https://www.meetup.com/speeddater-co-uk/

PLEASE NOTE: The attendees list on meet up doesn`t reflect the real numbers as we sell the majority of tickets on our website and other platforms.
For more info please visit: https://bit.ly/2HW1eMx

Happy Dating!

name: Berkhamsted & Tring Social
description:
Berkhamsted and Tring Social welcomes all friends and residents, new and established, to our social group. The aim of our group is to provide our members with opportunities to meet new people in the area with similar interests and to make new friends who want to get out and about in the local area. We will be offering a range of events and have a strong commitment to supporting our local community and local events. We will be aiming to offer a range of events, such as film nights, theatre trips, concerts, book club, the wine club, quizzes, pub nights, meals out etc. We will also be hoping to offer outdoor events such as walks and hikes and other physical activities in the beautiful Chilterns area around us.
Initially, due to lockdown, we will resume some of our regular events such as the book club (via Zoom) and walks (with limited numbers).
You will recognise our event hosts as the same people who made great efforts to provide members with a variety of events over several years in the former Berkhamsted Social group which has now come to an end. We will be looking for new, committed hosts with fresh ideas, too, to help our local group grow and develop, offering a range of regular and new events to suit the different interests and tastes of our members. Some events will have a small cost so that the organisers can cover the subscription fees, but many events will remain free of charge. We ask that all members keep their RSVP’s up to date and respect the efforts made by all hosts in offering local and varied events for our enjoyment.
Look forward to you joining us at an event soon!

name: The Constant Readers Book Club: All Things Stephen King
description:
In the words of the author himself "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once", so join us to enjoy and discuss the works of the King! \


Stephen King has written over 70 books, so we won't run out material any time soon. We will meet once a month, possibly every 2 months if we are tackling one of the really big tomes (I'm looking at you The Stand). Books will be set in advance and we will have an online meeting and an in person meeting for most books.
We can also delve into movie and TV adaptations, have movie nights with Netflix Party plus social events and quizzes.
I'm always open to ideas, so feel free to DM me with any suggestions!
I also co-organise the Horror Book Club, so if you are a fan of the genre in general, please do join us as well
[https://www.meetup.com/The-Horror-Book-Club/](https://www.meetup.com/The-Horror-Book-Club/)
And always remember - monsters are real!
\

name: Ladies Who Brunch ...and pretty much do everything else too
description:
This group is ideal for women who are time-poor and want to be able to drop in to social meetups with like-minded individuals at similar stages in their lives. 


Many women I know struggle with the same problem as they hit their mid-twenties/ thirties with most of their social network spread out all over the country. Many of us have moved from our hometowns, friends are scattered all over the place and long working hours make it pretty difficult to commit to hobbies. This Surrey-based member's group is designed to be low maintenance but there when you want it, as and when you are free.


The group is always open to suggestions for things to do, but will start on the basis of all things from fitness (runs, yoga, walks, gym sessions, dance classes) to coffee catch-ups, new lunch venues, as well as golf, film, fashion and career conversations/ networking. We welcome anyone to host a meetup, so if you'd like to see more events near you or fancy a particular activity, why not have a go? Similarly, If you have any hobbies or passions we could incorporate that you would like to share or teach - we would be thrilled. Just let me, Charlie, know.


Ultimately, this group is a great way to take a moment out of our busy lives, put the world to rights, share hobbies and skills, network, and enjoy those odd free evenings and weekends in the company of some amazing women.


**************************************************** 


Kindly Note: 

- Please ensure first names and photos are included on your profiles for membership consideration 

- We hope that this group will be full of fun, enthusiastic members, please contribute and RSVP where reasonable. It can be daunting attending an event for the first time - but please don't be nervous. The meetups are low-key and filled with genuinely amazing, friendly women.

- We welcome women of any age to join.

- Most of the meetups will be free, but to accommodate any charged events or visiting speakers/experts, some of the meetups may involve a small fee or deposit. Charged events include things such as theatre visits, cinema, lectures, exercise classes etc. Any fees will of course be communicated well in advance.

- To cover the cost of having the meetup group (currently £120/year), the meetup owner, Charlie, may negotiate with paid activity organisers for compensation, such as covering their ticket cost - this won't affect members and any fees will be communicated well in advance.

- If you would like to share a paid event with the group, where funds will go to yourself or someone you know, please ask the group owner, Charlie, in advance.


Any questions, please don't hesitate to get in touch. 

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Thanks and enjoy!

name: Marianna's Events : London Nightlife Social 20s, 30s, 40s
description:
We are inviting you to join Marianna's events in London! Having an extended experience of organising events, we started organising events on 2010, we are promising to create fun social experiences to help you explore London nightlife and connect with people/ make new friends in a fun and relaxing way/ atmosphere. Events that we are planning to organise include, but are not limited to, social nights out, live music, cabaret, comedy, games nights (ping pong, beer pong, card and board games), clubbing and business networking events. Our events are hosted by friendly hosts, which are there to welcome you, and make introductions, so there is nothing to worry about coming alone, most of the people come alone to meet new people. Of course friends are always welcome. The more- the merrier! Our social adventures are mainly targeting people in their 20s, 30s and 40s. We hope to see you soon, in one of our events! 

For more events feel free to join our facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453202104877514/

name: West London Riders Club (WLRC) - for advanced riders
description:
West London Riders Club (WLRC) is a motorcycle club for advanced Motorcyclists. It was started in 2016 by a group of around 40 friendly and experienced Advanced Motorcyclists  (IAM RoadSmart or RoSPA qualified). We believe in riding progressively but responsibly to high standards but with a 'safety first' attitude. We welcome like-minded riders (with RoSPA or IAM Advanced’s qualifications) for regular social nights (often with guest speakers), ride-outs (regular Sunday ride-outs are on the 2nd Sunday of the month), ad hoc rides, tours in the UK and Europe. 

We also welcome experienced riders, without Advanced qualifications, as Associates, subject to an Assessment ride, (which we can arrange for you) and a commitment to gain a qualification, within 1 year, through training with either RoSPA or IAM Roadsmart. 

Riding with us is for serious riders who want to ride with other bikers who share their riding values; to ride to a high standard and arrive home safely, with a smile on their face!

To join WLRC, there is a £15 annual fee and a Country Members' rate for those 50 miles from M40 J2 You are welcome to join us at an event as a guest, if you would prefer to check us out before joining.

Contact us via Meetup or info.wlrc@gmail.com

Homepage photo courtesy of Mark Manning www.markmanningphotography.com

name: Jazz Poetry Experiment
description:
Welcome jazz and performance poetry lovers in London! 

This group brings together jazz lovers, poetry lovers, performance poets and spoken word artists through live jazz and poetry performances. 

I organise Jazz Poetry performances where I invite members of the audience to perform with us in the second set. We get to hear world-class musicians and amazing unsung wordsmiths! We also get to mingle and make friends with like-minded people.

Taran, jazz poet

name: WIP Comics
description:
WIP Comics (or Work in Progress Comics, to give it its full name) is a group made to help aspiring artists, writers and comic creators move their ideas and projects forward. We have two monthly meetups — one to discuss what we’re all currently working on, give and receive feedback and constructive criticism on our work and bounce ideas off each other for new projects, and one focused more on the more practical elements of creating comics, from character design to world building.

All skill and experience levels are welcome, from complete beginners to established creators, and our intention is to support each other and create an environment where we can offer and ask for advice without judgement. Everyone has a different style, and there is no single ‘correct’ way to draw, write or tell a story, so we actively encourage a variety of different approaches and people coming from different backgrounds. Whether you want to make a sci-fi, fantasy, superhero, comedy, slice-of-life, autobiographical or any other kind of comic then we’d love to see it and help you get to a point where you’re happy with it.

Beyond the meetups we also have a podcast where I chat to various comic creators about their work every fortnight, and a Slack group where all the members are invited to continue the conversation online.

The group was established by Michal Ingram back in July 2011, and was originally known as the 'Graphic Novels and Comics, Critique and Collaboration Meetup'. It’s gone through various iterations and different organisers, but all with the core idea of helping each other make work we’re proud of. Over the years many people have forged creative partnerships and workshopped ideas with the group that have gone on to become fully realised projects.

We’re a very friendly, laid-back and welcoming group, and apart from advice and feedback then our Meetups are also a great way to meet like-minded people and just hang out to talk about comics.

name: Lovers of Black Theatre
description:
Hi Ladies and Gentleman

This is a meetup group for London theatre lovers out there.

Theatre is a huge passion of mine and I wanted to find other people with a similar passion. 

I particularly have an interest in theatre that recounts the black experience ,whether that be in the UK or abroad and many a time when I go to such shows, the turnout is not as full as I would like, hence the main reason for starting this group.

The plan is to watch shows from the likes of Arinze Kene, Wole Soyinka,Debbie Tucker Green, Roy Williams, August Wilson, Lorraine Hansbury, Inua Elams etc 

We will aim to shine a light on these productions, go down and support have fun and hopefully get to know each other in the process. 

I look forward to seeing many plays together :-)

name: London Art Appreciation Tribe  (LAAT)
description:
"Life is a beautiful gift, we just do not know it yet" 

We regularly visit art galleries, museums, and exhibitions, along with drinks at the pub. 

The majority of attending members is in the late 20s to late 40s bracket, however we welcome all age groups. Please join us if you'd like to meet some like-minded people locally, make friends and do some nice London activities together - exploring London, cultural events, exhibitions, theaters, hikes, meeting for delicious cups of tea.


Also please make sure you have enabled group message notifications as I will send update e-mails to attending members before an event. 

Visit the blog for more information 

l-aat.blogspot.com

Thanks for being considerate!

Cheers, 

Chiraq

name: East London Cultural Socials
description:
About:

This is an East London group that combines cultural activities and socialising. If you're interested in art, exhibitions, hiking, board games, food markets, immersive events and visiting places of historic significance this is the group for you! The majority of attending members are in their 30s or older, but all age groups are welcome. If this sounds good, please join us if you'd like to meet some like-minded people locally while exploring London and beyond.


Group etiquette:

The events are mostly held in smaller groups. To keep the group full of active members, membership is reviewed every now and then, so members who haven't attended anything or been inactive for an extended period of time will be removed, but you are always welcome to rejoin at any time.

Also please RSVP only if you are certain you can attend (of course things happen sometimes and you might have no choice but to cancel, in this case please make sure you update your RSVP ASAP). Members who repeatedly RSVP and don't show up will also be removed, to be fair and respectful to members who are on the waiting lists and do want come to the event. Unless it's a 'show up whenever you want' event, please aim to arrive on time, we will usually hang around for 10 min after meeting time, but unfortunately we can't wait around for people who are later than that as it's unfair to others who are on time.


Also please make sure you have enabled group message notifications as I will send update e-mails to attending members before an event.


Thanks for being considerate!

See you very soon,

Agnes

name: ‘We are artists’ - aspiring artists community group
description:
A meet up for aspiring artists to share ideas, tips, feedback or have a moan about the price of paint or beans. And, most importantly, to be creative.


Being an artist can be a solitary business – so the aim here is to set up a creative community for a bit of solidarity, inspiration and ultimately collaboration.


All artists are welcome, working in any medium, at any level, in the UK and elsewhere in the world. This group is not about being accomplished, but the transition from wanting to be an artist to being one – what does that take and how to earn a living.


The aim is to be fun, supportive and collaborative – and offer help, advice and talks on how to survive and thrive as an artist.


The sessions will be a mixture of zoom and social art workshops, art trips or stretching canvasses together.... Then as things progress, I plan to also focus the reality of being an artist. How to sell your art, and where? The best websites, and the worst. Studio costs? Material costs, free resources, financial help, the list is endless…


But obviously, this is a community effort, so any ideas of where to take this group are keenly welcome. 


A bit about me. I trained as a fine artist in my 20s, then rediscovered it at 45. Lockdown has been a wake up call, and I’ve been developing an abstract expressionist style since – in digital and on canvas. I’ve dedicated myself to being an artist, come what may. 


Life is short, so I’ve been told. 


Check out the group's insta page, where all the artists' work is shown:

https://www.instagram.com/weareartists_group/


Or go to our Pass the Picture WhatsApp or Telegram group for those looking to get feedback on work, collaborate or have a general chat. If you would like to join here’s the links:


WhatsApp: https://chat.whatsapp.com/JuTzQPMQKU5AKOaQywugHa

Telegram: https://t.me/joinchat/JmXcIyBjRDo2MDlk


And (phew), there is a Twitter account:

https://twitter.com/waagroup


Any questions? Send a message to Andy or email andrewrichards22@icloud.com


Welcome to We Are Artists

name: THEATRE and STUFF - Love London Theatre!
description:
THEATRE and STUFF is for anyone who wants to meetup to enjoy London theatre and combine it with some socialising. We like our theatre up close and personal so if you want to be within spitting distance of Ralph Fiennes, Tom Hiddleston, Juliette Binoche, Benedict Cumberbatch - this is the group for you! We always get together after THEATRE and STUFF events so that members can chat and get to know each other - after all, it is a meetup group! We're a friendly, eclectic bunch and you'll find us really inclusive. Everyone's welcome - including you, so hope to see you at a meetup soon! <br>

We do ask for a contribution of £5 when you join to help defray the group's running costs, but don't worry - it's well worth it! :) <br>

<br>

name: Life Drawing with ELSC
description:
ELSC are a bunch of feisty, feminist, fiercely independent women, who also happen to be strippers. They aim to shatter stereotypes and challenge stigma, whilst improving their own working conditions. They are bored of working in badly run strip clubs, being financially exploited and having very little say in how the venues are actually operated. To counter this they have begun organising their own pop-up events, to create their own working conditions.

In 2013 they began taking matters into their own hands, and started the world's first life drawing classes the The White Horse, Hackney's first strip club to open it's doors to artists, illustrators, painters, sketchers, doodlers, and anyone interested in drawing from life... in a unique setting! The members of the collective are among some of the best striptease performers in London, and decided to offer a rare and uncommon glimpse into their world. Their life drawing classes have become their flagship event, breaking through stereotypes and bringing the age-honoured relationship between art and sex work bang-up-to-date...!

Sadly, the White Horse venue is no longer, so ELSC moved to a different strip venue; Crown & Shuttle is an old school East End boozer, where back in the day strippers would entertain the rowdy masses, alongside bands, comedians and other louche entertainment. 

ELSC are inviting a whole new audience of visual artists to come and draw these amazing performers as they do their thing. All levels are welcome, same for gender. Materials are provided for £2 (free materials for students who bring ID), the class is lead but not tutored. £15 per person per class. Limited spaces available.

name: Acting Gymnasium - unique weekly acting workshop
description:
Following on from the OUTSTANDING CRITICAL SUCCESS of THE MERCHANT OF VENICE and SPRING AWAKENING in January 2022, HAMLET and SIX CHARACTERS IN SEARCH OF AN AUTHOR in June 2021, ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA in September 2020 - described by critics as '...the hottest ticket in town.'-  and before that Macbeth, A Flea In Her Ear, Miss Julie, A Doll's House, Midsummer Night's Dream, La Ronde, Platonov, Romeo and Juliet, Three Sisters, An Ideal Husband, The Cherry Orchard, Uncle Vanya, Ivanov, The Parasite and Playboy of the Western World - The Acting Gymnasium is looking for male and female actors to join our workshop. We will be working each week on elements of performance using our methodology informed and influenced by the ideas of Stanislavski, Vakhatangov and Nimerovic-Danchenko. This unique acting workshop will culminate in a TWO WEEK RUN of full productions at the 120 seat Tower Theatre in June 2022. 
Check the reviews at [www.actinggymnasium.co.uk](http://www.actinggymnasium.co.uk) 
\*\*\*\*\* (5 Stars) A Midsummer Night's Dream

\*\*\*\*\* (5 Stars) Romeo and Juliet
\*\*\*\*\* (5 Stars) The Cherry Orchard 
\*\*\*\*\* (5 Stars) Uncle Vanya 
\*\*\*\*\* (5 Stars) Ivanov 
\*\*\*\*\* (5 Stars) The Playboy of the Western World 
If you are interested in any of the following then The Acting Gymnasium may be for you: 
Weekly acting workshops Performing in a top quality theatre production 
Voice work 
Alexander technique 
Advanced characterisation techniques 
Improvisational character work 
Keeping your creativity sharp by regular workshopping 
Being seen by industry professionals 
Networking and connecting with fellow professionals 
Top quality colour photographs of your work to add to your portfolio 
HAVING YOUR WORK REVIEWED. 
Performing in a production that gets four & five star reviews may be the catalyst that gets you noticed by casting directors and industry professionals. 
Check out recent reviews:

[http://www.everything-theatre.co.uk/2013/11/ivanov-theatr...](http://www.everything-theatre.co.uk/2013/11/ivanov-theatro-technis-review.html) (4 Stars) 
[http://www.thepublicreviews.com/ivanov-theatrotechnis-lon...](http://www.thepublicreviews.com/ivanov-theatrotechnis-london/) (4 Stars)
[http://www.irishpost.co.uk/entertainment/theatre-review-i...](http://www.irishpost.co.uk/entertainment/theatre-review-ivanov-theatro-technis-london) (4 Stars) 
PLEASE NOTE ACTING GYMNASIUM IS A UNIQUE, TOP QUALITY WEEKLY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOP FOR ACTORS CULMINATING IN A SHOWCASE PERFORMANCE.

name: Free Stuff and Free Events - try new things
description:
Free talks, comedy live-streamed, open mic live, dancing online parties, pub quizzes live-streamed, yoga, theatre performances, clubbing, sports and more!!
More added regularly...
We have everything from chilled out music events to fitness classes, talks, workshops and even yoga! You're almost guaranteed to find something that you'd like to do, no matter where you're from and what you want to do.

Click 'join', and have fun! We look forward to seeing you at one of our events soon.

Join us! Everyone is welcome :)

———————————————————————————-

Join our Newsletter and get 50+ new freebies:
https://www.freestuffandfreeevents.com

Other ways to get freebies:
Telegram
https://t.me/FreeStuffandFreeEvents

Facebook page/group & Instagram:
FreeStuffAndFreeEvents
(We are giving away Amazon Vouchers soon!)

name: London Drawing Life Drawing Meetup
description:
Join the London Drawing Meet Up Group to hear about some of the best life drawing sessions in London. Join us for drop in sessions, Saturday workshops, courses, summer schools and very special life drawing events across the capital. Expect professional tutors and models in interesting spaces for conventional life drawing sessions, as well as completely unique creative life drawing events in significant venues across the city such as the Museum Of London, Battersea Arts Centre, The V&A and Design Museum. All our sessions welcome all levels of ability.

We hope to meet you in a class soon!

For more on London Drawing and what have got going on:

http://www.londondrawing.com/

For monthly news letters independent of Meet Up- support us and stay in touch via our own mailing list:

https://londondrawing.com/contact-us/

name: Art for the Uninitiated
description: Are you one of those people who say "I don't know much about art but I know what I like" ? Wouldn't you prefer to be able to say "I know what I like and I know why I like it" ? Do you love art but sometimes feel secretly guilty for not 'getting it'? Do you ever stroll through a gallery and feel you should be gaining much more from your experience? Do you end up leaving the gallery more tired and confused than enlightened or inspired? It doesn't have to be like that. In a regular series of online talks I will guide you through some of the fundamental ideas in Art. We will identify the key features of the main styles in art: Medieval, Renaissance, Baroque, Rococo, 19th c Realism and Modern Art. We will look at such essential components as technique, colour, space, light and shade, composition. We will examine the main subjects in art : Portrait, landscape, still life, religious, secular and mythological scenes. We will think about the ways paintings tell their stories - through expression or symbolism. You will gain fascinating insights, build up a solid understanding of chronology, increase the powers of your own observation, begin to trust your judgement and be able to express your opinions about art with confidence. Above all - you will have a lot of fun amongst some of the greatest paintings in the world.

name: Museums, Galleries, Tours & More
description:
For days, evenings and afternoons out at places of artistic interest, guided walks - with the option of a meal or drinks afterwards to chat, get to know each other, talk about what we've seen etc.

Open to anybody interested in the visual arts, and will include a mix of free and paid for events.

name: London Art & Drawing Meetup Group
description:
This is an affordable, friendly, community art and drawing group, for anyone interested in drawing from life, or in doing art workshops in a casual setting with music.

All levels of skills and experience are welcome. This group is mainly untutored, however there are facilitated workshops offered allowing for individual needs. The group always enables a great range of people from different backgrounds to share a common interest in drawing, or in other art activities, thus attracting artists, illustrators, designers or anyone who has little art/drawing experience and fancies an opportunity to develop their skills. If wanted, there is an opportunity to gain and share advice and practices also.

There are regular weekly Portrait and Life Drawing Meetups arranged, as well as other art workshops in the North London area. Please don't hesitate to contact us, or check us out on: www.facebook.com/londonportraitandlifedrawing

name: Network & Social - London Networking Events
description:
Network & Social - London Networking Events

Our events offer low pressure interactions, while allowing professionals to market themselves or their company in a completely relaxed and social environment.

Network and Social hosts weekly & monthly networking events in London, which allow individuals to grow their professional network and improve their communication skills.

Register to experience our unique approach to networking as you make long lasting connections in your city. We want fun people who know how to have a good time while being open minded to the opportunity of meeting new people. We strive to schedule events where you will hopefully have a positive experience.

This group is free to join and open to anyone who is looking to make new contacts and new friends. Feel free to invite your friends to join our group or bring them as guests to events.

This group is open for everyone, married people, new-in-towners, and people who have been in London area for a while and are simply looking for a new group to go out with in London. And you only have to be friendly and fun to join!

This group is free to join and our events are free or pay-as-you-go. To register you as a member we will need to use your email address, you will provide this to us when you book tickets for our events.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*
GDPR compliance & Meetup Mailing List

Meetup is a social group. To be eligible for FREE tickets to the events you provide us with and authorise us with the use of your email address, and you become a member automatically when you join us on at one of our meetup events. (you opt in when you buy a ticket/register for a free ticket).

We use your email address for our own purposes, to keep you in our membership database, keep in touch with you and to make you aware of news and upcoming events. The only information we keep/use is your email address. We do not sell your email address or let 3rd parties use it.

If you do not want us to use your email address. You can unsubscribe from our group emails at any time by following the link at the bottom of the meetup page or/ newsletter page or contact michelle@socialiteconnections.com

You can unsubscribe from Meetup messages (automatically generated) by changing your settings on meetup - please CLICK HERE ([https://help.meetup.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002863152-How-do-I-unsubscribe-from-Meetup-emails-](https://help.meetup.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002863152-How-do-I-unsubscribe-from-Meetup-emails-)) to see the Meetup Help article with instructions

name: Like-Minded People of Culture in London (23450+ members)
description:
This is the group for you if you are looking for social networking and fun times at social events involving culture, art, history, music, adventure, dancing, walking, networking and the outdoors. This is also the group for enjoying dining out and nightlife with singles as well as couples, professional networking and if you were interested in dating and relationships. 

London can be lonely place. It can be even more isolated if you are single, a bit older or if you are new in the city and do not have any friends or social network in the city. 

We want to bring together like minded people of culture who prefer to socialise at fun (and at times unusual) events, ideally in relatively quiet locations including bars, restaurants and parks where people can meet each other and establish connections and friendships beyond mere acquaintances.

Our meetups are carefully organised to ensure we are small enough in number so that we remember most names and exchange numbers with many by the end of it. We will also try and maintain a reasonable balance between women and men at our events. We will strive to offer a comforting and warm group which is international in outlook with a high degree of sensitivity and warmth. 

You may be single, attached, married, separated or a grand dad! (this is not a group exclusively for singles either and couples are very welcome!) Please be open to new friendships and experiences. We could go to bars, restaurants, cruises, trips, concerts, sports events, holidays, dances and parties, yoga etc. and so the meetups will be diverse.

This club will be about friendships and connections but above all having fun together with friends.

I look forward to meeting you at one of our meetups soon

With our best wishes and regards


Anna and Dan Raj

name: Art with the Experts
description:
Do you love art and art galleries? Would you like to know more about art made in the past and the art made today? Would you like a helping hand with visiting and understanding permanent collections and temporary exhibitions in London?


Whether your interests lie in techniques, portraits, costumes, art styles or just good stories in art, chances are these will be covered here in the course of a varied programme of online talks and occasional in person study days at the National Gallery with me or occasionally one of my fellow art historians. Look back at past events of talks I have given during lockdowns - recordings are available at £5, just get in touch with your organiser Lydia Bauman directly on this site

name: Dartford Books and Culture Club
description:
Meet kindred book lovers in a local Meetup Book Club!

You'll read a new book every month and we'll get together to talk about it. Come to laugh, share stories and make new friends!
In our group we aim to broaden our reading horizons, enjoy stimulating discussion, meet new people and most importantly have fun. We read broadly, so if you are only interested in one type of book, that is just not what we do.

We meet monthly on Saturday mornings in a private room at Dartford Library. Meetings start at 10.30 and usually finish by 12.30. More often than not, we'll go for a drink or lunch after the meetup too.
We encourage active membership! Members are expected to read the books for the meeting, participate in discussion and occasionally even chair the meetings.
The not so nice stuff... Unfortunately, those who do not at least look on the meetup site, or attend one event within six months time, will be removed from the group. But let's just hope that you love the group as much as we do!

name: London Art Museum Creatives
description:
**London Art Museum Creatives is a group for anyone who enjoys the art world in any capacity. We enjoy making art, learning about artists, materials and new techniques and supporting each other in our own creative journeys.**

If you're a beginner in the arts or a professional artist, then you're very welcome.

**I do request that you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend events as we have vulnerable members (myself included) who need to be kept healthy and safe.**

So you can expect to wear a mask for events that are held inside and prior to attending, you'll need to take a lateral flow COVID test and send me your negative results before you attend. 
For outside events, you will also need to take a COVID test prior to attending to protect everyone.

I also encourage everyone to fully read an event's description as I do put a lot of work into trying to cover everything an attendee might need in the description, so make sure you've fully read everything before reaching out to me with further questions.

* **Anyone unwilling to take a COVID test before an event will be removed from this group.**
* **Anyone claiming to be exempt from wearing a mask indoors needs to send me a message explaining why this is before being allowed to attend.**
* **Anyone not yet vaccinated will not be allowed to attend any event.**
* **Anyone who tests positive for COVID will not be allowed to attend events and will need to keep me updated when they have a negative COVID test result.**

If you have any questions/concerns about this group, it's events or anything else please feel free to send me a message here on Meetup and I'll do my best to answer as soon as I'm able. *(Please be courteous, don't sell me things or flirt.)*

Sorry if my rules are strict, but after my fight last year with cancer, I'm very aware of how important it is to keep others safe in my community, hence my rules. I appreciate your understanding. 

Thank you for joining my group and I hope to see you all at a future event!

-Franceska
Organiser

[www.thefranceskatree.com](www.thefranceskatree.com)
[www.franceskadrawstrees.com](www.franceskadrawstrees.com)
[www.toothpickmoon.com](www.toothpickmoon.com)

name: Nudie Nature Life Drawing
description:
Join us for unguided life drawing at some of the funnest pubs in North London!

Each week we will be drawing different models, mixing it up with a variety of poses and times.

A large selection of materials will be provided, though you are welcome to bring your own if you desire.

All abilities are welcome, and everyone is invited to stay on after the session to meet other participants, share your work (if you feel like it) and enjoy a drink and a chat, we’d love to see you there!

name: Love2Sketch Life Drawing
description:
Love2sketch is a drop-in life drawing group based at The Selkirk in Tooting offering weekly untutored art classes every Tuesday evening for absolute beginners and experienced artists alike. We alternate between traditional life nude and burlesque themed events with a different model to inspire you each week.

Love2Sketch is all about having fun and enjoying being creative. So don't worry, there's no annoying 'tutor' hovering over your shoulder giving you unwanted advice on how your drawing could be better. However, if you're a beginner and want some support, please let us know - we’ll be more than happy to help.

Come and join us!!!

name: The Secret Society of Art known as Secret Art London
description:
This is a private membership group for patrons of London's Secret Society of Art, known as Secret Art London.

Secret Art London is headquartered at its art gallery in Shoreditch at 28 Cheshire Street, London, E2

Secret Art London produces events, shows and exhibitions of an immersive nature, at top secret locations, inspired by the physical and digital art and artists which it represents.

Membership is by invitation or participation only. To participate, simply visit https://secretartlondon.uk/events and book yourself into one of our upcoming public events, such as our street art walking tour and scavenger hunt (win original art worth up to £200!) and upon completion you will be presented with a document which will unlock your free membership to this private group.

name: Different Planet (dp)...  art - culture - wellness
description:
Different Planet (dp)... art - culture - wellness.   Different Planet is all about people from different cultures coming together to socialise and enjoy art, cultural and wellness activities primarily in London.

It resumed events in September 2019 after being dormant for a number of years. Different Planet attracts professionals, artists, students and the genuinely open-minded.

Through our activities (events we attend or organise) e.g. exhibitions, socials, gigs, board games, drinks, talks etc, we aim to expand the opportunities for people of similar/ differing cultures to share experiences and interact in a holistic and sincere manner.

If you enjoy these type of activities and engaging with people from around the World who have different cultural perspectives you are welcome to join us.

Different Planet is secular, apolitical and non-discriminatory.  It is unable to accommodate people who do not share or choose not to conduct themselves in accordance with these values. 

********************************

Organised by Different Planet: art - culture - wellness network

www.diffplanet.net

name: London Arts & Culture Group
description:
This is a group for anyone with an interest in Art Galleries, Museums & Culture. You will find the groups activities entertaining if you enjoy visiting Museums, like Literature, or study any other art related subjects. We meet to visit, and learn more about the Art & Culture on offer in London.

The group meets every Friday, visiting:

National Gallery (1st Friday) 

V & A Museum (2nd Friday) 

British Museum (3rd Friday)

Tate Modern (Last Friday of the Month) 


Hope to meet soon

name: Like minded people  in London (2750+)
description:
This is a group for people who would like to explore art & music, theatre & museums and attend talks and lectures in the city of London. There are a huge number of these in this city at any given time and we ought to make it out to see, hear and experience them. It is particularly nice to do all these things in a large group so that we could identify other like minded people while also being able to discuss our experiences after our meetups.
We will visit these venues every week and after the visits meet at a cafe or bar for some refreshments or a meal where we can chat and discuss.

name: Art 2 the People London
description:
We are a friendly artist led group where people from all walks of life who truly appreciate art can come together to visit artistic spaces and events. We believe that art can be loved, understood and discussed by everyone, and we aim to provide a friendly atmosphere where everyone can view art outside of the mainstream establishment. Our group is inclusive, accessible and passionate about artistic self-expressions.

Keywords: <br>Art exhibitions <br>Art social events <br>Gallery tours <br>Community art events <br>Art projects <br>Art workshops <br>Free art events <br>Open studios

name: 2B Or Not 2B Collective Life Drawing
description:
About 2B Or Not 2B Life Drawing Collective:

2B Or Not 2B Collective are a BIPOC run life drawing group based in London with an international audience, and their objective is to uplift marginalised and underrepresented models whilst unifying different communities through art. They focus on fostering new connections, artistic development as well as mental wellbeing.

Since coming online, they've been sponsored by Lululemon in their Keep Going '21 Campaign, partnered with The National Gallery, featured in Griff’s live stream from Tate Modern, and currently have partnerships with the NHS, UAL, British Red Cross, and Bafta nominated animation studios such as Cartoon Saloon to name a few.

They've featured all types of models from BIPOC, trans, plus sized, models with visible disabilities, to acrobats, dancers and have raised money for numerous charities such as Mind, Impact Lebanon and The Trussel Trust.

Their online sessions are and always have been pay-what-you-can to make art accessible to all with a focus on fair pay for models and collaborators.

For more information and updates you can follow:

Events: www.2bornot2bcollective.eventbrite/com

Instagram: www.instagram.com/2bornot2bcollective

Website: www.2bornot2bcollective.com

Replay Library: www.gumroad.com/2bornot2bcollective

name: London Improvisation Meetup
description:
**Meet new people to practice improvised music, movement and storytelling in good company.**

This group is for people interested in improvisation for both personal and professional development. We're a nice mix of experienced people, butterflies, and beginners. Everyone is welcome to join: floor cleaners, actors, postmen, dancers, bank robbers, government advisors, musician, geography teachers, and their sisters, passers-by, square people, round people, even the odd triangle people. 

If you are looking at connecting or re-connecting with yourself and others, this is a good place to start. 

We organise outings, workshops, evening courses, and shows, currently mostly on Zoom. We also run impro shows where you can just sit and watch.

name: Contemporary Art London
description:
This is a group for those interested in keeping their eye in on the London contemporary art scene. We regularly visit new exhibitions across the city including attending Private Views with the intention to see as much as possible, to make friends and connect with other arts professionals and to build our knowledge of the contemporary art scene in London.

Events we see are designed to help you explore new exhibitions (as opposed to permanent displays) and new spaces across the city. Not all events involve 'Contemporary Art' - some may be, for example, pre-20th Century Art exhibitions, visits to Open House events looking at architecture, and occasionally walking tours of outdoor sculpture.

Group events are fun and designed to be both informative and just a good day/evening out. Members are welcome to bring friends and we'll often book a table for lunch nearby an exhibition. We also always try to end each event by heading to a nearby pub/cafe/place to sit down and have chat about the work we've seen, the themes around the work, curatorial decisions and much more.

So welcome to the group and get yourself RSVP'd for some of our forthcoming events!

name: Brush Party UK
description:
Come to a Brush Party event and experience a great night out! It’s all about fun… get yourself a drink from the bar, settle down to your canvas and unleash your inner Van Gogh!

It doesn't matter if you've never picked up a paintbrush. Our artist will walk you through creating your masterpiece. You’ll be delighted as your blank canvas transforms in only a few hours, made all the better by great music and a glass of wine or two!

You don’t need to bring anything apart from yourself… We provide everything… a quality canvas, all the paint you need, brushes, aprons, and the environment for you to have a great night out.

We are not sticklers, we are all for you mixing it up a bit… If you feel confident, you can interpret our instruction any way you wish… maybe you’d like to change the colours to suit your décor? We love it when you go ‘rogue’ – we might even learn a thing or two!

name: London Life Drawing (previously: Bethnal Green Life Drawing)
description:
Come along to this lovely, lively Life Drawing class taught by Adrian Dutton (http://www.adriandutton.com) in 4 different venues in Central East London -  Bethnal Green E2, Hoxton E2 and Earls Court SW5.

We have been getting together for serious drawing work (and the odd drink afterwards!) for 15 years. Newcomers always welcome! This class suits people of all levels of experience. Adrian, Mark and Tom are all professional artists and their teaching style is hands-on, affirming and very warm and friendly. But it is the atmosphere of the group itself that really makes this drawing class so special. Come along to check us out, or email  Adrian at info@adriandutton.com to find out more.

We now run different life drawing groups every weekday evening from 4 different venues across Central & East London:

• Mondays: London E2, Hoxton:  83a Geffrye St, Hoxton, E2 8JA

• Mondays: London SW5, Earls Court:  The Rembrandt Sampling Room, The Bolton, Earls Court Rd, SW5 9BQ

•  Tuesdays: London E2, Hoxton:  83a Geffrye St, Hoxton, E2 8JA

• Wednesdays: London E2, Bethnal Green: Garrett Centre, 117 Mansford St , Bethnal Green, E2 6LX

• Thursdays: London E9, Hackney: Royal Inn on the Park

• Fridays: London E2, Bethnal Green: Garrett Centre, 117 Mansford St , Bethnal Green, E2 6LX

We have great details on each individual session, maps, directions & photos of the venues etc. inside each individual meetup description. So click on one that interests you and all the details will be displayed! And if in any doubt or you cannot find us, phone 07966 925 723, or email adrianmarkdutton@gmail.com

Materials: Don't worry if you have come out without any materials - all materials you need are available at the class or bring your own! We have charcoal, pencils, inks and lots of other bits and bobs. Materials cost £1 per session including good cartridge paper

Cost per class is £10 per evening or you can buy a block of 5 sessions for £42.50 - (these don't have to be taken consecutively, you can take them ANYTIME and they are valid at ANY of our classes!)   

Times: Our classes all start at 7pm but don't worry if you're late, just come along! We usually have a 15-20mins break halfway through, then we continue until 9.30pm. 

Here are some photos taken at some of our classes:

name: The Hobby of Acting - online :)
description:
Let’s meet online to play and develop some new (or old) acting skills.

Our online acting sessions are for you if:

* You ever thought about taking up acting.
* You did drama in college, uni, school and you miss it.
* You ever needed to speak in front of people and wishes you had some more tools (and some more confidence).
* You like to play and be creative (and sometimes silly).
* You want to meet people while being at home.
* You are an adult (but really a child).

We will play, learn skills, create and perform.
We will become free when performing and more confident in front of people.
We will make new friends and get to know ourselves in a new way.

All of the sessions in this Meetup group are online.
All of the sessions are suitable for beginners with little or no experience.
More experienced performers are very welcome to join and play with us too :)
Most sessions are run by [Theatre Gym](https://www.theatregym.co.uk/) and Tal Jakubwiczova

name: London Portrait Drawing Group
description:
"This is a group for anyone interested in Drawing Portraits Online, in Person and at Hybrid classes drawing models and other attendees. All skill levels are welcome always knowing that you can easily improve at home, get confident faster than ever before and participate to face to face Drink and Draw Portrait events. 
I started this group to meet other Portraiture enthusiasts, improve, become more and more expressive and Bold as well as going the super realistic way. Looking forward to exploring this sociable creative activity with everybody in London and anywhere." I Would love to also see faces again, we drew 15 years ago at similar in person events, that would be nice!
We also need assistant organizers who can Draw portraits and help others in doing so, in their 20's, 30's 40's, to come forward so that with our support they could run Local events for creative individuals and groups.
Too many people used to go to Life Drawing classes where they could never finish a drawing, because of Faces. Now you'll get to learn, practice, Improve and use Portrait or Life Drawing zoom recordings to continue drawing from home. Ipad and tablets are more than welcome.
Let's share the same Passion and have fun while doing it! :).
Tony

name: Oxford Arts Events
description:
We are a friendly and informal social group for arts and culture enthusiasts in and around Oxford. If you love music, spoken word, dance, cinema, comedy, theatre, galleries and museums and more, do join us. If you want to promote an arts event and are happy to host a Meetup on the day please contact the organiser.
Meetup site costs are approximately £200 per year. A £2 annual contribution is requested.

name: London Museum Art and Outings Group
description:
The purpose of this group is for all to have fun exploring London's Museums, Galleries and to go on interesting outings and excursions.

Everyone is welcome in this group wether you are new to London or have lived here for years... We will make our days out fun inclusive and entertaining for all ages.

name: Life drawing Aldgate and Shoreditch London: Toynbee Art Club
description:
Drop-in Life-drawing and painting for beginners and experienced. Explore your creativity in response to a different live life-model every week. All materials and equipment provided. Session fee is currently £12.00 cash for over 2 hours of art making. If requested, full drawing and art instruction can be given, perfect for beginners who want to find out what drawing from a model is all about. Portfolio development and advice for entry to higher level courses applications is available. More info on IG @artdesignfutures
Artizan Street Library and Community Centre. 1 Artizan Street, London; E1 7AF. 
Entrance is sign-posted in Gravel Lane: Press Buzzer '101 Call' - lift to 1st Floor.

name: London Performing Arts Meetup Group
description: This is for everybody. Improv is great for those who want to improve in public speaking. Actors and improvisers and for anyone who wants to have fun.

name: Drawing London on Location
description:
This is a great group for anyone interested in drawing London's urban landscapes and parks, city landmarks, cemeteries, museums and galleries.

Sessions are very relaxed. Everyone splits up once a meeting point is picked out, so that we can all wander about to find something we're interested in drawing. Then at the end of the day and sometimes at lunchtime too we gather back together for a drink and to show what we've done. There is no tuition, but seeing other people's work is always a great way to see new techniques and ideas and get inspiration.

The group is entirely drop-in, so there is no obligation to enroll or attend every week, people just come when they can make it.

All sessions are absolutely free, all you'll need are materials you want to work with and a little money on your oyster card. All levels are welcome, hope you can join us!

Follow us on Instagram and Facebook:

https://www.instagram.com/drawinglondononlocation/

 https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Art/Drawing-London-On-Location-277592452780717/

name: Considering.Art™ (UK)
description:
Oh, Hi. 👋 We are Considering.Art™ - a new LIVE cultural engagement network that's as unique as you are. Join us!

Unlike a typical museum / gallery tour, here at CA - it's not really about us, we are more interested in you. Never repeated and uniquely yours, our interactive and explorative video tours last typically 60-90 mins in duration, and are facilitated LIVE by your very own 'museum' guide. Cool right?

With a focus on contemporary art, together we aim to explore some of the most pressing issues of today - bringing thoughts, feelings, and observations into a fun, lively and sometimes challenging exchange.

Developed in collaboration with a team of NYC art world professionals, in response to COVID 19 closures, we are super excited to welcome you into our global community as we join each other on this exciting journey.

Once registered, your unique and direct link to our Zoom viewing / meeting room will be provided. Events are FREE to attend and open to all. This is LIVE arts engagement for all. Never recorded. Uniquely yours. Your voice. Your idea.

Fancy a chat? Have an idea? Interested in presenting? Reach out via info@considering.art - we love hearing from you ❤️.

Let’s do this... why not book a free tour today?

name: London Dramatic Art Meetup- Theatre, Film Et Cetera
description:
For those interested in drama and theatre arts. You could be a newbie, wanting to try things out or a fanatic who goes at least three to four times a week. Welcome!

We go as a group to theatre to most west-end theatres and non west-end theatres including  Arcola, Almeida, Hampstead, Kings Head, Young Vic, Old Vic, Donmar Warehouse, The National Theatre etc with lots of socialising pre and post show. 

We are a small group who would love to get to know you, the individual, better. We keep our meetup numbers to usually not more than 10 to 12 people. Please join only if you are interested in turning up for a meetup event. There are plenty of online discussion forums and newsletters out there, but we are about making friends whilst enjoying theatre/drama, and in the spirit of Meetup, to meet face to face. 

London theatre scene is fabulous- if you want to go out every night and suffer theatre fatigue, this is easily done. If we go to every play out there, there would be no time for work or a balanced life. 

Whilst easy to put up every play out there in our calendar (cut and paste from theatre listings!), we would rather not. We take pride in being selective, adding must-sees alongside under-rated or under-exposed productions, prefering quality over quantity. You will not see a menu listing every show in theatre land, but our choices are carefully considered. This is the group for you if you are a discerning theatre goer and want to make the most efficient use of your leisure time...!

We are not a ticket reselling site, but we do aim to get members the best deals on offer including group discounts, priority bookings and low cost tickets. Our members benefit from high value tickets at lower cost, not 'cheap' tickets (these are easy to find). There may be booking fees and paypal fees added to some ticket prices, and any additional fee goes to the running costs including priority memberships, producers/ supporters circle/donations, administration costs, banking and paypal costs. This group does run at a loss, due to the costs above and especially management time costs of the Organiser, but we do it for the love of theatre and the love for theatre going people. 

It's free to join this Meetup group but we tend not to retain non-active members. To help with running costs, there is a one off £10 Theatre Pass fee to pay on your first booking to join an event.

name: Life-Drawing Workshop @ Islington Arts Factory
description:
Welcome to the Islington Arts Factory Weekly Drop-In Life Drawing Sessions. The sessions have been running for 25 years!


Classes are untutored and drawing materials are not provided. Paper can be purchased at the Reception.



Fee is £10 cash to be paid at the venue.

name: Life Drawing at The Birds
description:
Life drawing sessions


This class is for all drawing levels, aiming to improve your own drawing style and learning about drawing the human form and anatomy in a relaxed and friendly environment. The class invites you to study guided or untutored with professional models in a variety of different poses. Beginning with a series of short poses and warm up exercises from 1min to 5min. Longer studies follow with 10min, 20min and 45min.

Each week we will learn and be inspired by a new model. They will be of different genders, ages, physiques and ethnicities.

You will find art materials, paper, easels and tables in a well lit, spacious setting. We are a welcoming, friendly and sociable group.


£40 advance / 4 sessions starting at the beginning of each month.

£13 drop-in / 1 session


https://www.meetup.com/Life-Drawing-The-Birds/events


Bring your friends, spread the word.


See you soon


Jennifer

name: Art Humanist  (Drawing, Painting & Photo)
description:
We are a very happy bunch of creative minds and souls in and around London who want to immerse themselves in creativity by simply doing it as often as possible using "humanity" as our focus/inspiration. We Draw/paint all kind of people, Portrait other members in Person or Online and photograph each others without looking for beauty or perection. We seek personality and humanity that we capture in anyway we can.
Cost and fees:
About 50% of our events are Free but aren't if there are costs involved such as models or venues. When not Free we make the cost just about high enough so that we at least break even so £6/event or £5/week pass with 3 to 4 events/week.

To join this group you'll need to be at least 18 years old in the same way you need to be to join Meetup.com.

This video was shot for TV when I was doing whatever I could to save Life Drawing classes from extinction which nearly happened passed the millenium. This was shot in 2013, when I was doing about 12 classes a week between Anywhere in London mainly in Pubs, but also in Parks, Squares, in the Tube, in Offices, for Private groups and where no one has ever drawn before... In 2004 only 20 classes were left in London, 650 weekly were happening in 2014. It's always good to feel useful at something :).
Tony (Facebook- Insta - Web)

name: Outside the Box - Life Drawing
description:
Get creative and have fun in the comfort of your own home at our quirky online life drawing club via Zoom hosted by Shevon from C4's 'Drawers Off'.

Each week will play host to a different theme, with our nude model accessorising in anything from Burlesque to Bollywood and sometimes the odd mythical creature. Posing in dynamic positions for a really vibrant drawing session.

We run every other Wednesdays 19.30 - 21.15 (GMT) Check out our events for more details.

All levels welcome…there’s no such thing as ‘I can’t draw’. We encourage people to think outside the box,
this is figure drawing with a difference.

Part of the evening will be lightly tutored with experimentation into different techniques and materials to mix up your style for a selection or short and long poses ( 3 - 20 mins)

name: Candid Arts Drop In Life Drawing Classes
description:
Life Drawing Drop-In Daytime & Evening Classes


Every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday* 11am – 1pm
Every Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday* 7 – 9pm


(*except bank holidays)

No need to book, just drop-in!

Wednesday morning and evening sessions are long pose sessions, which allows students to work on one drawing for 60 minutes.

Thursday morning sessions are one pose sessions.

£9 per class

Materials available to buy – paper (25p/sheet) & charcoal (25p).

Loyalty cards available – Attend 9 drop in classes and get the 10th free. 

All levels welcome.

name: South East London Life Drawing
description:
A friendly life drawing group suitable for all levels, especially beginners.

The sessions begin with optional tutor-led drawing exercises with some general drawing tips and suggestions, before self-led longer poses of 15-20 minutes, with help available if needed.

After a tea break (refreshments included in the price) the second half is one long pose of around 40 minutes with a more studious, self-led approach, again with tutor assistance one-on-one as required. It is all presented in an accessible format.

All materials including easels, paper, charcoal, pencils, chalk & coloured paper, and even a half-time cup of tea are provided in the price of £10.

Pay on the day with cash or card. (20p charge for card payment).

It is hosted by full-time artist Rod Kitson in his studio-gallery space in Surrey Quays, SE London. You can see his work at www.instagram.com/rodkitsonart

Full address: **The Art of Isolation gallery**
**47 Upper Floor**
**Surrey Quays Shopping Centre**
**Redriff Road**
**London, SE16 7LL**

How to find us:
We're on the upper floor of **Surrey Quays shopping centre**, at the top of the escalator, in the **Art of Isolation** shop next door to Boots Opticians.

**Tube is Canada Water (5 mins walk) or Surrey Quays (3 mins walk).**

More info on the venue's Instagram page **www.instagram.com/isolationartlondon**

name: London Art Sessions
description:
London based artist Martin Ireland is running beginners and intermediate level oil painting classes, covering the basics including colour, tone and composition.

These workshops are done in a studio in Balham. They are a great way to unwind after work and explore oil painting.

For £25 per 2 hour session with all materials provided, these drop in classes are affordable and fun.

name: Candid Arts Friday Life Drawing Meetup
description:
Draw, drink and socialise.
Set in the fantastic Candid Arts Sky Lab with stunning view of the city, these tutored life drawing classes provide an opportunity to socialise with like minded creative people.
Two life models are arranged for each class and included in the ticket price are two complimentary drinks.


Price: £15 (inc a free drink)

Materials: You can either bring your own materials or buy paper and charcoal at the class.

name: SLD Guided Life Drawing!
description:
Soho Life Drawing is London’s ultra-welcoming, drop in life drawing class right in the heart of Soho. Just minutes away from Leicester Square Station, enter a world of peaceful, pressure free drawing with some of London’s top models, and enjoy socialising during our mid-class tea and biscuit breaks. New to life drawing? Don’t worry—you’ll be in good company—people from all walks of life and all backgrounds try life drawing for the first time every session :)


Our first hour is lightly guided, with gentle verbal tuition for beginners while our second hour is self directed—although you’re more than welcome at any point in the class to ask questions—in fact, we’re delighted to do so!


Here are the details:


Location: “The Meeting Room” (Quaker Meeting House): 8 Hop Gardens, WC2N 4EH (Buzz “Meeting Room”)


Times:

Thursdays


18:30-19:30PM: Guided Session

19:30-20:30 Tea Break + Longer Poses


1 Hour: £10.50

2 Hours: £12.50

name: Theatre Improv
description:
This is a group for anyone interested in improvisation theatre shows and workshops.

Improvisational theatre involves creating characters, plots and scenes in the moment.

Improvisation is a skill that also enhances listening, team building and communication skills.

name: Covent Garden Life Drawing
description:
<br>

Untutored, drop-in life drawing in central London

We've got a great session running every wednesday and Thursday in two London venues, one model every time, and all the equipment and materials you need to get drawing. These are untutored sessions which means they're perfect for novices and experienced artists alike - no pressure, just have some fun doing your own thing.

One of the the best things about Covent Garden Life Drawing is the artists who attend. A really diverse group of cool, friendly people, and genuinely mixed ability. It's very sociable both during the tea break and at the pub afterwards.

So why not come and join us?

Life Drawing

every Wednesday 7pm to 9pm

this class is in Millman Street, London , Holborn WC1N 3EW Community Centre Just press Community centre button

Every Thursday 7pm to 9pm

24 Haverstock Hill NW3 2BQ


<br>

Prices

£13 per session

Drop-in, no need to book

RSVP or drop-in, latecomers also welcome

Why you'll love our sessions

- Friendly, sociable group -


- Untutored -

- Mixed length poses -

- All the equipment and materials you need -

- Easels -[only in Holborn]

- Small drawing boards and comfy seats -

- Suitable for all abilities -

- Socialising over tea at the interval and afterwards in the pub -

- Central London location -

<br>

<br>

name: Amateur Drama Class
description:
If you are looking for something creative and fun to do on Monday and Wednesday evenings after work, then join me for an amateur drama class that I will be teaching at the Omnibus Theatre Clapham from 6:30-8:30 pm.
