These classes are wonderful to build confidence, connect, meet people, and learn acting skills. We usually go out for a drink at the local pub after each class to further know each other. 
For more info contact me at catherine@thebrightdaycompany.net. First trial class is half price at £10 (different payment plans offered after that). 
I look forward to seeing you there!

name: Primrose Hill Life Drawing                  @lifedrawingph
description:
Thursdays 6.30pm - 8.30pm £10
Since most people aren't wearing masks now, and we have vulnerable people in the class, we'd really appreciate it if you have cold symptoms to please either lateral flow test before coming or come next week instead. 
Friendly atmosphere, for all abilities. Run by a professional artist for over ten years. Varied, inspiring models.
Boards, easels, tables, chairs are provided. \


Tea, coffee, biscuits are included
Please bring your own drawing materials
If you’d like input, please ask
Easy, free parking from 6pm.
10-15 minutes walk from Chalk Farm or Camden tube stations.
Hope to see you soon!
Sophie
The organiser reserves the right to refuse admission or to ask you to leave the class without refund if your behaviour is deemed unsafe or inappropriate by the organiser.
London life-drawing, near Central London, Camden, Hampstead, Belsize Park, Kentish Town, Bloomsbury, Euston, King's Cross.

name: Catford Life Drawing
description:
Join us for our weekly life drawing session at the Ninth Life in Catford in a beautiful room on the first floor.

Best to bring your own drawing materials but we will have some paper and a small selection of drawing materials that you can use for a small contribution. 

Food and drinks orders are now being taken at the bar again. Please place orders to support the pub!

Walk-ins on the day are allowed unless the sessions are fully booked. 

**Note for first timers:** this is not a formal life drawing session but a relaxed drink and draw experience with a life model. Beginners or seasoned artists – everyone is welcome!

**\*\*\* Strictly no photography and recording during the sessions \*\*\***
**\*\*\* Strictly no BYO food and drinks \*\*\***

name: WLD Artists
description: Life drawing for all levels with optional tuition.

name: Cafe Sketchers
description:
Hello again. It's been a long break and I will still be covid-cautious, so adding some airy venues for summer. I hope you can bring your sketchbook for a little social drawing over lunch or coffee. Info below.....




Are you an artist free to sketch on a Friday? Like to draw from life but a bit shy about doing it alone?  Meet other artists for a casual lunch and sketch.  Venue-based for comfort and sociability, but informal and inexpensive.  We gather every Friday in various relaxed eateries and coffee shops, from the West End to Richmond, to draw our surroundings and chat through the afternoon. You're welcome to join us - just bring a small sketchbook and some food money.
Note - Most of us get there for lunchtime as it seems only fair we put money across the counter before hogging the tables for the afternoon.  This isn't a class and nothing is booked or provided - we're just normal cafe customers, so best to order something before getting materials out, in the same way you would if taking your laptop to a cafe. We must keep things neat on food tables so we don't get complaints about hygiene, so no using cafe mugs or glasses for paintbrushes please.

We don't post photos of artists, and there's no 'end time'. It's just a social thing so come and go as you wish.

If sharing your cafe drawings on social media, you may want to use our hashtag  #cafesketchers, and feel free to add your sketches to the Meetup page.

My own work is here if you're curious... 

https://www.instagram.com/beckybell.artist.adrift/
https://beckybellartist.sumup.link/

name: Life drawing for men
description: This weekly life drawing workshop provides gay friendly artists the experience of drawing the male figure in a supportive environment.

name: Soho Life Drawing!!
description:
Soho Life Drawing is London’s ultra-welcoming, drop in life drawing class right in the heart of Soho. Just minutes away from Leicester Square Station, enter a world of peaceful, pressure free drawing with some of London’s top models, and enjoy socialising during our mid-class tea and biscuit breaks. New to life drawing? Don’t worry—you’ll be in good company—people from all walks of life and all backgrounds try life drawing for the first time every session :)


Our first hour is lightly guided, with gentle verbal tuition for beginners while our second hour is self directed—although you’re more than welcome at any point in the class to ask questions—in fact, we’re delighted to do so!


Here are the details:


Location: “The Meeting Room” (Quaker Meeting House): 8 Hop Gardens, WC2N 4EH (Buzz “Meeting Room”)


Times:

Thursdays


18:30-19:30PM: Guided Session

19:30-20:30: Tea Break + Longer Poses



1 Hour: £10.50

2 Hours: £12.50

name: Acting Classes in London
description: Looking for an acting course London based to fill knowledge gaps in your craft? ADS has short term courses, workshops and drop-in classes to get you started and on track to elevate your acting technique. Our focus on screen acting, audition and the business of acting means you can raise your screen acting game today. If you feel your text analysis work needs improvement, take up a scene study course to enrich your script work. These courses along with voice courses, movement courses, BEAT repetition classes, accent and RP workshops are run periodically providing solutions for actors from beginner to advanced level. Discover the range of workshops, course and classes we offer.

name: Nature & Art Lovers Walking Group
description:
If you are looking for walking group with nature & art lovers and creative types you have come to the right Meetup. We are a group of like minded individuals who love nature, walking, discussing everything arty and creative and venture to different locations in and around London to marvel at the wonderful nature that is so close to London.
We meet once a month with our pack lunch, note or sketch books / Ipads and walking boots.

name: West Essex Arts, Photography & Culture Group
description:
Come along to our events, exploring what the local and surrounding areas have to offer with like minded people and make new friends!

Our members come from Loughton, Epping, Chingford, Walthamstow, Buckhurst Hill, Woodford, South Woodford, Chigwell, Wanstead, Claybury and surrounding areas. We have visits to art & photography exhibitions, galleries, museums, fairs, festivals, live music, walks, statley houses, castles and places of historical interest, gardens, parks, pubs, meals and coffee.

Photo opportunities at most events which you can share with the rest of the group on the meet-up and Facebook pages. 

We usually have time for a drink, refreshments and a chat during or after the events at a local pub.

Events are local and further afield including Essex, Hertfordshire and London.

Join us today and don’t forget to sign up for some interesting and fun events, meeting new people and making friends!

name: Drink and Draw
description: Unleash the artist within, learn a thing or two about drawing and enjoy a tipple or three on this inspiring sketching social. You’ll have the chance to practice your drawing skills with guidance from an experienced and down to earth art tutor and a host of other scribblers. Ideal for beginners, but all levels welcome

name: London Drawing Community and events
description:
This group is part of the Network for Figure Drawing like Myspace is for Music or FB for paying for ads and is called the Life Drawing Network based in London and Brighton UK with Main Groups in New York, London, Brighton, Toronto, Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles and members as far as China or Greenland. We don't mind coming up at some point with a new name, let us know of any great name you have in mind.
We ran Figure Drawing classes since 2004 when there was only about 10 2D Figure Drawing classes left in London UK. This was the time when Ipad/Wacom tablet classes started to overtake. We, I mean I went a bit mad about it and by influencing as much as humanly possible we had 650 classes weekly in London in 2013 and run about 120 in 10 years, in all areas of the city, was seen on Tele, Radio, press regularly. This crusade was about anything and everything but capital gain and hasn't changed. For absolutely everyone to be able to draw, Online zoom classes are perfect as you always get the best seat and can use equipment that you can never use at the Local weekly classes.

**Classes:**
**Saturday and Sunday** every 2 weeks I meet Londoners in Central London Park, Hyde Park corner and gently push others like Clissold Park Locals to do the same, like I did, as those are Free events. If I am in Brighton someone else's welcomes guests on the day.
**Monday:** Every Monday as this is the most regular class of the week, I or someone I trust guide the group which again is only possible online, for 1/2 the session. Then I turn my camera towards my Drawing board or using the chat on zoom, help those who turn their own camera on their drawings. Other participants will never hear, see anything so a bit like private tuition. This is something offered only to those who really mean to achieve results in the future and need to pay a tiny £5/week that helps me pay the models with and all our video and running of our website. Without those people keen to achieve and me absolutely keen to help them none of all this would ever be possible.
Those who don't need help on that day simply put the volume down.
**Tuesday** is our together day for a little extra Socializing and to draw each other's faces mainly. Sometime hands, or feet, Costumes, hats, jewelry etc... To keep the experience fun fun fun who ever poses must do a funny face before the more or less still posing for 20 mins :). If you llok like anyone let me know so more will turn up. The first time we did one one those, before any Doodle events ever existed was in 2006 and was called Happy Drawing Circles with up to 20 in each circle.
**Wednesday** about every 2 weeks depending on level of attendance we do Exceptional Life Drawing themes that most attendees go to Live or continue drawing after the class from the recordings if they are Weekly members (£5 all incl.)
**Thursday** is our Partly clothed to completely clothed/costumed models day also every 2 weeks on Low season and weekly otherwise.
To recapitulate: A live experience cost £2.50, A live experience and/or working from the recording is £10 or the weekly pass inclusive of all events is £5/week or £7.50 for Pro Class organizers who need little help.
For a complete list of what this Pass gives you feel free to read our Prices page at www.thelifedrawingnetwork.com
**The motivation** part is also in our pricing as if you Buy a £10 ticket to be able to work/finish your work from a video, if you email us a Drawing that we can exhibit on our Life Arts Gallery page, we refund £7 and will show your Art to potential buyers/investors.
If you want or intend to model one day for classes we let people give it a go at the end of any of our classes and offer Completely Free services to them for Life, my life.
If you or someone you know would like to be promoted for anything in person, from Artist, Art teacher, Class organizer, Art writer, let me know.
We'll be writing the History of Comtemporary Figure drawing so please share good old times stories... I'll share mine from anywhere.

**Tony**
[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tony.a.gallery/): Days when I was running Voila! Life Arts Galley in Central London-
[Instagram:](https://www.instagram.com/lifedrawing/) Days I was running very busy classes by Leicester square where Central Saint-Martin used to be-
[Flickr ](https://www.flickr.com/photos/lifedrawingsocietycouk/albums/72157719223461051)\- Mainly my ball ben drawings as I always drew for as long as I carried a ball ben so from the age of 6\.
Discord: Smitone#2038 - For what technology can bring to us 2D Artists up to 3D Virtual reality.
[Twitter - ](https://twitter.com/LifeDrawingUK) [Linkdln](https://www.linkedin.com/in/tony-picano-49613527/) \- eukart\(at\)msn\.com\.

name: Theatre Gym - Beginners acting classes
description:
Let’s meet online and in person to play and develop some new (or old) acting skills.

Our online acting sessions are for you if:

* You ever thought about taking up acting as a hobby.
* You did drama in college, uni, school and you miss it.
* You ever needed to speak in front of people and wishes you had some more tools (and some more confidence).
* You like to play and be creative (and sometimes silly).
* You want to meet people while being at home.
* You are an adult (but really a child).

We will play, learn skills, create and perform.
We will become more free & confident in front of people.
We will make new friends and get to know ourselves in a new way.

All of the sessions in this Meetup group are online.
All of the sessions are suitable for beginners with little or no experience.
More experienced performers are very welcome to join and play with us too :)
Most sessions are run by [Theatre Gym](https://www.theatregym.co.uk/) and Tal Jakubwiczova

name: SALSA  NORTH LONDON
description: Salsa on the hill at the Laboratory Muswell Hill.Start you weekend off and get in the mood to go out dancing. Beginner/improver class.Cuban style with New York cross body.Let meetup!!! Friendly class cool music;beginners welcomed.

name: Helen's Walks
description:
Helen's Walks are inspired by one of the world's most wonderful cities.

Come and discover some the most fascinating corners of London, or see familiar places in a different light. There is always something new to learn about London.

It's many diverse delights might have been here for centuries or just opened last week, that's the joy of London and there's no one better to explore with than Helen, her enthusiasm for the city is infectious.

Helen has lived in London for 30 years and has worked as an actor, tour guide, stand up comedian and prize winning poet.
Her love of London's rich history, its arts, architecture, food, green spaces, wildlife and constant reinvention will probably keep her here for 30 more years.

Join Helen’s Walks now to enjoy visiting her favourite sites, incite your imagination and gain more insight into fabulous London.

name: St Albans Life Drawing
description:
Join Life Drawing St.Albans. For those interested in figurative drawing. Perhaps you studied art at college or university and always enjoyed life drawing or perhaps you've never tried life drawing before. Well here is your chance....

      run by illustrator Bob Wright. Sister Meetup group to Stevenage life drawing, bringing you more life drawing dates held in St Albans at the fantastic Trestle arts base. We'll be creating art and figure studies using nude artist models.  I'll be on hand to bring you tutelage and a critical eye. I'm always working on my knowledge of the human form and its my aim to bring you some drawing insight as I continue my artistic journey. Please feel free to contact me directly if you need any further information. 


contact: Bob email: bobwright@pencilwright.com tel. 07811190714

Venue website: http://www.trestle.org.uk/

My website: http://www.pencilwright.com/

Models: Please do not post Directly onto page, send me your details directly, I'm happy to take them.  Fair warning: local models close to St Albans & Stevenage get priority, London travel via public transport will usually exclude you from my roster, Trestle is a fair distance from St Alban's station and causes expense and punctuality issues. So local based models and models able to travel by car within an acceptable petrol cost distance will get priority.

name: Brixton Stand Up Comedy
description:
Join us for a showcase of some of the brightest talents on the London Stand Up Circuit.
We're located 3 minutes walk from Brixton station at the Trinity Arms Pub.

Date **Every 2nd Wednesday of the month**
Doors open **7:15pm**
Show starts **7:30pm**
End time \~**9:30pm**
Ticket price - **£5**
(https://www.designmynight.com/london/whats-on/comedy/edgware-comedy-club-thursdays)

This Meetup is for people who are looking for something social to do on a Wednesday in Brixton.

You can get drinks from the lovely bar stuff before you find a seat.
And we like to stick around after the show for a couple of drinks.

All the best,
Louis

name: Twyford Drama
description:
The purpose of this meet-up group is to stage plays and pantomimes in Twyford, Berkshire

To achieve this we need stage hands, front of house, artists, technicians, designers, singers, dancers and whole load of other skills. You can also of course audition for a part in one of our shows!

Twyford Drama is being organised by Twyford & Ruscombe Theatre Group to introduce new people to the fun and satisfaction of staging live performances. No previous experience required. 

If you decide to partipate in our performances then we will ask you to join the theatre group and an annual membership fee of £20 will be payable in June.

We will be holding a variety of informal events, roughly once a month. There will be no charge o these dates. There will also be social evenings, for which there may be a nominal charge to cover costs.

name: Urban Space Walk Meetup
description: With the aim of unravelling just one strand per walk of the fascinating but complicated interlocking pieces that go to make up the history of our city environment, we will meet at a significant spot for an orientation then after suitable seasonal refreshment we will follow the story in question wherever it leads, but always to a thrilling end point...along the way we will gather information from buildings, landscape, artefacts and street furniture...

name: The Solo Art Group
description: The Solo Art Group is a group of artists that has been established for some time. It has already organised 3 group shows and published 2 magazines. The first has the title SOLO and it is a physical magazine distributed to 150 U.K. galleries. The link to it is www.issuu.com/soloprojects. The second is an online art magazine and the link to it is https://bit.ly/ART_LOVE. Instagram: art_lovemagazine. The purpose of the group is to work on further issues of both magazines and to organise more exhibitions. Members get priority in taking part in exhibitions and be included in the magazines. There are also plans for meetings to discuss various art subjects and outings to galleries. Any artist, .curator, collector and generally anyone who is interested in the visual arts should join. Currently we are open for contributions to the ART_LOVE online magazine specifically for the Art for Sale and for the Interviews sections. We do not charge fees or commissions. You can apply directly to the Organiser at ronisvarlaam@hotmail.com.

name: Camberwell Life Drawing
description:
Let's get together for some drawing and a glass of wine!!

**Camberwell Life Drawing** is a group for anyone that want to spend a chilled Wednesday evening creating some Art in a relaxed, friendly and bohemian atmosphere.

We are entering our 8th year and the sessions are still untutored and ***ALL skills and levels are truly welcome!!***

So please, don't be shy and come to see us! We make sure to have a nice variety of great Models for you to enjoy different styles and body types and will be using the same model for 2 weeks consequently; the 1st week we’ll do short poses and the 2nd week longer ones.

We have PLENTY of material for you to use like drawing boards, pencils, charcoals, pastels, paper etc...but feel free to bring your own too in case you might not be satisfied with what we offer.

Looking forward to meet you all! xx

name: London "Artist's Way" Meetup
description:
This meetup group is for people working through the creativity book 'The Artist's Way' by Julia Cameron. Each week we review our work on a specific chapter of the group, including our experience of the Morning Pages and the Artist's Date. The format of the group is based on Julia Cameron's sacred circle concept and if the group decides to do some exercises as part of the meeting, they will be in 'creative clusters'.

This group will be self governing with meetups being suggested by members.

Check out the Message Board for Artist's Date ideas and to share your views on future meetups.

Mutual Fanclub: Developed by members who have completed the AW course, this monthly meeting helps you to acheive your creative goals by giving you what you need most - a personal cheerleading group! Watch out for our special six-month project building to a Mutual Fanclub Showcase in spring.

name: Anerley & Penge Life Drawing
description:
Let's get together for some drawing and a glass of wine!!

Anerley & Penge Life Drawing is a group for anyone that want to spend a chilled Monday evening creating some Art in a relaxed, friendly and bohemian atmosphere.

We are entering our 2nd year and the sessions are still untutored and ALL skills and levels are truly welcome!!

So please, don't be shy and come to see us! We make sure to have a nice variety of great Models for you to enjoy different styles and body types and will be alternating SHORT & LONG poses; one week we’ll do short poses and the following week longer ones.

We have PLENTY of material for you to use like drawing boards, pencils, charcoals, pastels, paper etc...but feel free to bring your own too in case you might not be satisfied with what we offer.

Looking forward to meet you all! xx

name: The Portobello Drawing Academy
description:
The Portobello Drawing Academy holds a weekly meet up for artists to draw from the model.

Please bring your own materials and join our relaxed atmosphere.

If you require any more info please contact us by email.

Ron

name: Performing Arts for Adults who want to have fun!
description:
Looking for a fun way to spend your evenings? Join us at one of our free performing arts workshops!

Free taster classes that we run include Comedy Acting, Diva Dance, Contemporary Dance, Ballet, Musical Theatre, Acting and Singing!  

See our website for full details about all of the courses that we offer.

name: London Shoal of Art Meetup
description: LONDON SHOAL OF ART MEETUP runs regular weekly drawing and painting sessions in person and occasional online sessions. All abilities Welcome. Tuition available is desired. We have been getting together in London for over 10 years. We allow time for people to share their work and chat as well as to learn and to make art together. Subjects include portraits, landscape and still life. We also look at art in museums and galleries for inspiration.

name: Chelmsford Life Drawing
description: Chelmsford Life Drawing is a group for anyone that wants to create art in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Life drawing is one of the best ways to unwind, relax and improve your art skills. The sessions are tutored (if you would like any help) and all skills and levels are welcome!! So please, don't be shy and join in. Materials and Refreshments are provided.

name: 🌈BrushTherapy🎨Painting workshop👩🏻‍🎨✨👨🏻‍🎨
description:
Hi, I am Flora, a colourist - oil painter👩🏻‍🎨

Luckily in my very early age I learned how to express my personal feelings through the
colour - my paintings are reflecting my personality and relationship with nature🍃🌻🦜
I started to organise a painting event where I can show you how to lift up your feelings and fly with the flow using your creativity ✨\*\*Let's colour your soul!\*\*🦩

Brush Therapy is an art workshop where you will create your own canvas painting with the step-by-step advice from me.
***Absolutely no experience necessary*** *\- just paint and have fun\!* 🤩

**All materials included** 🎁
\- All art equipment \(apron\, easel\, paints\, paintbrushes plus a canvas that you get to take home with you\!\)
\- 3 hours session with my guiding
\- GIFT Home Kit to support your painting journey
 
🌈 **Join to the next Painting session - in Hampstead** 🎨
    🌸 *www.florafekete.com/brushtherapy* 🌸
🌈 [BrushTherapy](https://www.instagram.com/fekete.official/)🎨

#PaintingEvent #Hampstead #SipandPaint

name: Film, Production and Performing Arts
description:
Through our networking events we aim to encourage filmmakers to meet and build professional relationships, with each other, potential employers and experts in different fields of filmmaking.

We also hold a variety of workshops, speakers and panel discussion and crowdfunding courses to educate independent filmmakers on how to develop, finance, create and distribute their films.

Finally we hold a variety of competitions with a variety of prizes which help filmmaker bring their visions to the screen.

name: Dulwich Art Group - Life Drawing & Painting in South London
description:
**Life Drawing and Art Classes In Dulwich, South London**

The Dulwich Art Group and School is a small independent art school with a focus on observational drawing and painting.

We have regular drop-in life drawing sessions run by practising artists where you can draw from a nude model and get feedback on your work if you want it. We also have a portrait group with a new model every couple of weeks

We have long and short pose groups. In a long pose group we have one pose for the whole session. You'll find people drawing and painting in a variety of media; charcoal, pencil, pastel, watercolour, acrylic and oil are all well represented. We usually hold a pose for two weeks which allows time to produce something finished.

Short pose groups are ideal for learning to grasp the essence of what we are looking at and for describing it quickly and with economy.  Poses will vary in length from one minute up to twenty or more. If you're trying to loosen up or to develop your own visual language repeatedly drawing the figure with a time constraint is very helpful. If you're new to life drawing we'd always recommend this format.

You'll find details of our tutored groups on our website, they are delivered by professional artists whose work we admire and who have a love of sharing their knowledge and a gift for communicating it. [Read More Here](https://www.dulwichartgroup.co.uk/)

name: THE WORKS - Brighton Art & Design Meetup Group
description:
Welcome fellow creatives to this biweekly Monday evening Brighton art & design meetup group.

My name is Arnie, I'm a Brighton based visual designer and I started this group for a few reasons:

1\. Meeting and getting to know local creative people and\,
2\. To take a break and relax for an hour or two :\)

Stepping away mentally from the work you do, giving yourself time to reflect on it, bouncing your ideas of other creative minds, listening to other's perspectives...
We need this not only as creative people to get better at what ewe do, but also for our overall health and peace of mind.

So... if you're a creative mind that can relate to this, I feel you might enjoy this group. All types of creatives at all levels of experience are welcome. So don't be shy!

name: Stevenage Life Drawing
description:
Join us for Life drawing in Stevenage, run by illustrator Bob Wright. Sister Meetup group to St Albans life drawing, bringing you more life drawing dates held at Stevenage community arts centre. We'll be creating art and figure studies using nude artist models, I'll be on hand to bring you tutelage and a critical eye. I'm always working on my knowledge of the human form and its my aim to bring you some drawing insight as I continue my artistic journey. Please feel free to contact me directly if you need any further information. 

contact: Bob
bobwright@pencilwright.com


Venue website: http://www.stevenageartsguild.org.uk/
my website: http://www.pencilwright.com/


Models: Please do not post Directly onto page, send me your details directly, I'm happy to take them. Fair warning: local models close to St Albans & Stevenage get priority, London travel will usually exclude you from my recurring roster, train and additional public transport results in expense and punctuality issues. So local based models and models able to travel by car within an acceptable petrol cost distance will get priority.  Still I have used London based models on occasion in emergencies so no harm e-mailing me.

name: Watercolour Workshop
description:
Exploring the art of watercolour painting in a fun approachable way through playful workshops and excursions in London.

This group is for anyone interested in watercolour paintings. We meet regularly and learn about different techniques, find new inspiring places to paint and generally share our experience of working in this sometimes tricky but always rewarding painting medium. <br> <br>I am always on hand to provide guidance, share stories of my experience, teach you tricks and give an insight to the painters who inspire me. <br>

name: FORBIDDENDOG Performance Life Drawing and Decadent Dining
description:
FORBIDDENDOG curates UNIQUE Performance SHOW Life Drawing Events and NOW also Decadent Dining Nights + after-party.

All events are Ideal for birthday party nights, LGBT nights, date nights, nights out with friends and for the ones looking to experience something different and enjoy OUT OF THE BOX shows and experiences.

© FORBIDDENDOG Events since 2019.

name: LGBT Culture Lovers
description: A social group for those in the LGBTQ+ community to meet up for cultural pursuits - high culture or low! Theatre, Concerts, Gigs, Musicals, Opera, Dance, Film, Art, Photography, Exhibitions, Galleries, Museums, Historic houses, London history, Food (or other) Festivals, and anything else of a cultural bent.

name: Queer Women’s Theatre Meetup
description: Want to meet likeminded people for theatre trips in Brighton, Hove & beyond? Look no further. Once a month we go see a show then have a drink. Friendly, fun group. You don’t need to be a theatre ‘expert’ to join.

name: SLD Evenings!
description:
Soho Life Drawing is London’s ultra-welcoming, drop in life drawing class right in the heart of Soho. Just minutes away from Leicester Square Station, enter a world of peaceful, pressure free drawing with some of London’s top models, and enjoy socialising during our mid-class tea and biscuit breaks. New to life drawing? Don’t worry—you’ll be in good company—people from all walks of life and all backgrounds try life drawing for the first time every session :)


Our first hour is lightly guided, with gentle verbal tuition for beginners while our second hour is self directed—although you’re more than welcome at any point in the class to ask questions—in fact, we’re delighted to do so!


Here are the details:


Location: “The Meeting Room” (Quaker Meeting House): 8 Hop Gardens, WC2N 4EH (Buzz “Meeting Room”)


Times:

Thursdays


18:30-19:30PM: Guided Session

19:30-20:30: Tea Break+Longer Poses



1 Hour: £10.50

2 Hours: £12.50

name: Brighton Creative Cafe Meetup
description:
Brighton Creative Cafe Meetups are all about getting together, working on our creative pursuits and discussing creative ideas! 

It’s about sipping on your favourite drink as you unwind with the joy of creating a beautiful work of art and enjoying time for yourself.

name: London Arts and Culture Meetup Group
description: This is an accessible group aimed at doing more cultural things. I want to keep this group relaxed and welcoming so whoever you are please do come along and together lets see and do interesting things.

name: North London Life Drawing
description:
We offer life drawing classes and workshops in North London area. Experienced models and tutoring available if needed with professional artist Piero, so beginners are welcome as well as experienced artists. If you don't know much or anything about drawing, come along, this is a place try.

At the present we run weekly class on every Monday at The Post Bar, 316 High Rd, N15 4BP, (5 min. walk from Seven Sisters tube station). Relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Food and drinks are available at the bar.

*** 7- 9 pm - life drawing.
*** Tutoring available on request.
*** Limited number of places with online pre booking only.
*** covid_19 measures apply.
*** food and bar available.

All art materials are provided.

*** PRE-BOOKING essential on info@5rhythmswithkat.com, or mobile: 07886935716

@https://www.facebook.com/pieropierinidrawings

@Piero Pierini – Argentinian artist, studied art at the University of Buenos Aires, (BA hon in Fine Art and Drawing) , has been working as a professional illustrator in UK for the last seventeen years and has been involved in working with different art charity projects. He is passionate about helping individuals to find they way of expressing their own artistic 'voice'. He has a rather strong sense of humour and an easy way of being.

name: Unbound Moving Arts
description:
This is a group for anyone who may benefit from the transformational and healing gifts of the moving arts. Through 5Rhythms dance, movement and the creative arts.

We are committed to bringing movement practice into support of growth for individuals, communities and the world field. We operate as a CIC (Community Interest Company) and we seek to welcome all dancers and 'non-dancers' into movement and art.

name: The Sketchbookers (Oxford)
description:
Calling all amateur, professional and curious wannabe artists, this might be the perfect group for you! Drawing is action. I have had a passion for the arts since childhood.

'The teaching of drawing is the teaching of looking.' A lot of people don't look very hard - David Hockney
This group is an opportunity to:
• draw/sketch/create (whatever you like to call it) in a group environment.
• see other ways of expression
• spend a few hours broadening horizons on sketching and drawing
• practice. Doing is thinking. And looking!
Afterward, maybe find a pub for a nice long drink and share ideas on art and have a laugh!
Everyone has the ability to draw. I look forward to meeting you at an event!

name: Artists and Illustrators
description:
This group is open to all artists, illustrators, animators, cartoonists and Graphic artists, professional or amateur, who would like to share the experience of drawing and painting from life.

Any member can make suggestions or host an event, so that we have a range of activities to suit everyone.

When we are working indoors - please bring along 'clean materials' that won't leave a mess behind!

Useful to have a pub or cafe nearby, so that we can have a sociable time too and get inspired by exchanging sketchbooks (not compulsory for the very shy!)

name: Artistique Paint Club - Clapham
description:
Artistique offers a painting experience with a difference. You’ll produce a gorgeous piece of art with your own individual twist, in the company of like-minded folk and perhaps a glass or two of wine. You’ll be amazed by what you’re able to create, and you'll leave with your very own masterpiece! 


Why: Its creative, relaxing, sociable … and an entirely different and utterly awesome night out! 

Who: Absolutely everyone! No artistic talent required, our events are for all levels! 

Where: The Exhibit in Balham, The Trafalgar Arms in Tooting and Bunga Bunga in Battersea

When: Event runs 1930 – 2200 on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays (check website for more details) 

What’s the damage: Tickets priced at £35 (discounted to £25 for Meetup customers) including all materials and instruction  


Check out www.artistiquepaintclub.com and come join our little painting revolution!

name: Tours by Grace Meetup group
description:
I am a London Tour Guide, offering fun, informal tours of some of my favourite places in London.
We will be visiting art galleries, museums, parks, and royal residences - among others!

name: Sirens Online Life Drawing with Biro Boy & Violet Empire
description: People who want to explore drawing no matter what level. We have an open forum for ideas and welcome suggestions from models and artists.

name: Improvisation classes with Improvable
description: Improvisation is a fantastic tool for acting, comedy, and life, because it means saying, “yes!” and supporting your team members to create a show. You’ll surprise yourself with the things you come up with, and be amazed at how comfortable you start to feel being silly on stage. You’ll meet some of the most positive and lovely people in the world at improv classes as well, and hopefully make some very good new friends. These classes are suitable for just about everybody, no matter your background.

name: Become an Artist - London
description:
Are you ready to do some art and meet like-minded people?

So you came to the right place! =D

You don't have to be a traditional artist, have an art degree, be the "creative type" or be born with the "gift" (I hate this concept) to make art and express yourself artistically. Art is for everybody that wants to make art. It doesn't require a formal training, just the will to express something. It doesn't have to be shown as well. It just has to be made and explored. Art is a channel for your feelings to be translated while you are doing it.

This Meetup group is to bring together people that are looking for a personal growth through creative expression. To empower everyone to get involved in personal artistic projects.

It's a creative playground and a safe environment to explore self expression.

We will test tools and techniques together, get inspired by other artists, talk about how to get in touch with our creative side and also make like-minded friends in our journey. There will be a combination of free and paid events.

To create better events for you, please let us know: What do you struggle with the most when creating art?

Also, what kind of art would you like to be doing. Vote here!

Look forward to meeting you!

And welcome to Become an Artist - London!

Instagram @tobecomeanartist

Cheers,

Juliana


****By signing up for the "Become An Artist - London" events, you agree to our Terms and Conditions.

name: Kindred
description:
Kindred is a members club for those who want to amplify their work, have bigger conversations, meet incredible people, and have more fun. We have a heart for community and connection, so we have created an environment where open-minded, curious and passionate people can learn from one another and spark off each other. We host a variety of events to match a wide variety of tastes: from speaker series supper clubs, to breakfast networking, to late-night piano bar sing-a-longs; all designed to make Kindred a place where your ideas are welcomed, where you feel accepted, and where you can talk to anyone. 

We have co-working memberships available from £150/month (full all day access - including use of co-working spaces) and social memberships which are free for a limited time (access from 5pm, includes events, discounts and extended happy hour!) Apply on our website www.wearekindred.com for memberships.

name: ART & CULTURE - LEVEL
description:
Hello! This Meetup community is organized by LEVEL and focuses on all things art and culture!

LEVEL is a group of experts who believe in power of art to initiate personal transformation. We deliver high quality talks and discussions that improve cultural competence and expand our own emotional intelligence through art.

The aim of the project is to use artistic practices (like painting, architecture, fashion, language etc) to explore different meanings, philosophies and values of foreign world views. Dismantling stereotypes, cliches and prejudices in a peaceful way of learning holds a beautiful potential to build compassion towards others and simply enjoy the process of understanding arts.

We offer online lectures - join our events and embark on a journey towards a new perspective!

name: London Creatives
description:
An open group for creative minded people to get together, hang out and share their creativity.

Musicians, artists, writers, dancers etc. Performers and creators of all kinds are greatly appreciated! But all people and plus ones are welcome.

If you wish to share your craft, collaborate, make connections, make like minded friends or just talk about art forms and ideas, this is the group for you.

Bring your instrument, paints, notepad, whatever! And come express yourself with us! 🤗

Join our WhatsApp for more info:

[https://chat.whatsapp.com/GnaPE4VIFTBE3HIvM2O28s](https://chat.whatsapp.com/GnaPE4VIFTBE3HIvM2O28s)

name: Ridgmont Life Drawing Meetup
description:
Friendly and welcoming group for people of all abilities who are interested in practicing drawing and painting from live models - we run both portrait and life drawing (nude model) sessions.

Our "home" location is just over a mile from J13 of the M1 at Husborne Crawley Reading room hall, which is easily accessed and convenient for Husborne Crawley, Aspley Guise, Woburn, Woburn Sands, Milton Keynes, Bedford, Flitwick, Ampthill and the surrounding area.

Our venue can seat 20 artists, although we usually run with around 16 -18 of us. We always pose our models under studio quality lighting to create dramatic and sculptural shadows, which makes the job of drawing easier, and the resulting work more impactful.

This is a group for any ability, the only pre-qualification for entry is the desire to draw and create. Although it's generally an untutored group, help, support and advice are always freely shared. Most people will find working within a group of mixed style and ability something that helps them to find and develop their own practice. There are often specific events for skills development which will be displayed as "workshops". 

If you're nervous about coming, ping us a message on here and we'll make sure we do what we can to alleviate your tension. Life drawing and portraiture is hard, but that doesn't mean it won't be fun!

We're here to help!

name: Creative eXchange  (Berks & Hants)
description:
Are you creative?  Then this is the group for you!

Creative eXchange is all about sharing ideas and enthusiasm across a broad spectrum of creative endeavours.  The goal is cross-fertilisation of inventiveness and skills in diverse disciplines: This generates the vital energy and inspiration you need to be productive in your chosen field.  Note: This meetup is a not-for-profit group.

Whatever your field of creative activity, it's extremely helpful to bounce around ideas with other positive, enthusiastic, inventive people.  Members with a wide range of skills and talents, provide objective feedback, encouragement and constructive advice for each other.  We exchange new ideas and get a different perspective on our current projects, always in a relaxed, fun and sociable way.  

We promote regular social and creative meetings, workshops and collaborative projects, with emphasis on the exchange of ideas between creative disciplines - music, painting, photography, creative writing, poetry, drawing, sculpture, printmaking, textile arts, glass art, interior and garden design, illustration and so on.

We have an annual theme, deliberately open to wide interpretation (currently "Action/Reaction" - see project discussion here.)  The aim is to use it as a starting point for invention and making, leading up to a group exhibition at the end of the year.  We want to encourage as much diversity as possible in the creations we exhibit, including 2-dimensional art and as many other forms as we can practically show the public. 

Watch out for up-coming meetups in which we will share, discuss and develop project ideas.  Please don't hesitate to contact your group organisers to request or offer workshops on any specific technique or topic.  Remember to Track discussions you're interested in, to receive notifications of updates.

Wishing you the best of creative energy!

name: Crouch End Figure Life Drawing
description: This is a group set up to enjoy life drawing in a different way and in a real artist Studio. Located in a busy and interesting creative hub like all artistic Studios, these meetings are a chance to draw with professionals, learn from each other and also relax in a cosy, friendly environment over a cup of tea, coffee and sometimes drinks at the pub. My sessions are varied and memorable, and sometimes I invite athletes, dancers, theatre performers, contortionists, etc. This group is open to both professionals and beginners. I look forward to welcoming you to The my Studio Olympia Industrial Estate, Unit 3, Studio 8, Coburg Road, Wood Green, London N22 6TZ.

name: Art and Wine Evening Group
description:
Based in my studio, my art class aims to provide a couple of evenings a week where you can expand your creativity in a social and laid-back atmosphere. I'll provide a glass or two of wine (or tea&coffee), materials, subject matter and advice from an artist, all for £20 per person, or £15 if you book five weeks of classes up front!

Head to my website for more details

https://www.charmainechaudrydesigns.com/artandwineevening

name: ACT - Aspire, Connect & Thrive
description:
Collage Arts, an organisation of artists, look after the old post office in Wood Green's library mall, along with a disused warehouse space in Coburg Road, a old sweets factory in Coburg Road, and a empty council building in Cumberland Road, collectively known as the Collage Artspaces. We create artistic opportunities in Wood Green’s Creative Quarter. Learn about what's on offer, connect, participate, share skills, experience art.  

We run:  
Collage Voices - creative expression, performance, writing, digital music for 8 to 28 year olds, 
Collage Works - creative, digital and enterprise skills for over 18s. 
Collage Events - jazz, live music, spoken word, childrens theatre, and exhibitions at our venue, Karamel - McQueens Theatre, and annual N22 Open Studios. 
Collage Arts is an ethnic minority-led, arts-led, social action and educational charity. We have been developing and connecting creative communities in and around Haringey for over 37 years.  
www.collage-arts.org

name: Sussex and Surrey Improv Comedy Meetup
description:
If you are interested in theatre, comedy, performing, storytelling, writing, meeting creative people in the local area or just having a laugh, then this group is for YOU!

Improv is the art of collaboratively creating theatre in the moment. It can be dramatic, it can be funny (it doesn't have to be!), it can be emotional, it can be musical, it can be anything! It's brilliant to behold and it's liberating to do. There's no wonder its taking the world by storm at the moment. It's a fast growing scene in London and Brighton right now but there's not much improv in between the two cities. This is where we come in!

There's a great variety of ways you can become involved with 'The improv community of Sussex and Surrey'...

- Join us in our Zoom improv workshops from anywhere across the globe.

- We meetup in Horley and Crawley at least once a week to practice improvisational theatre techniques in fun and supportive workshops. (Currently postponed for obvius reasons)

- Participants of these workshops have the option to become involved in showcases in local theatres. These are really fun to be in or to watch

- We're always going on trips to see improv shows in London, Brighton or anywhere in between.

- Then there's all our other social events (in the pub mostly)

We sail under the banner of 'Dingbats Improv' and you can find out more about us on our website www.dingbatsimprov.com

name: Life Drawing and Painting London
description:
Welcome to Life Drawing and Painting London


This group is for anyone with an interest in art who wants to improve there skills whilst meeting like minded people


Members will be kept up to date on regular events such as sketch meetups & portrait drawing workshops


For more information contact:

russellflexman@hotmail.co.uk

name: Acting For Beginners
description:
This is an Acting class for beginners (professionals and non-professionals) but everyone and all degree of experience welcomed.
 
Acting exercises include (but not limited to): relaxation, improvisations, games, storytelling and text work (a bit later on). Aside from learning more about acting, these exercises provide wonderful tools to build confidence, get more more comfortable with public speaking and interactions, and connect to yourself and others. And it’s fun too!

Part of this upcoming term will be dedicated to scene work which we will showcase on the evening of the 6th of July for friends and family at the Omnibus Theatre. 

 My name is Catherine and I have been acting for the last 20 years and teaching in various drama schools for the last 10 years. I hold an MA in Actor Training and Coaching (teaching Acting) from the Royal Central School of Drama.

 The session starts at 10:00 am and finishes at 11:30 am on Fridays. The trial session is 10 pounds and should be paid before the session in order to reserve your spot. Different payment options are available if you do decide to come back.

 The class is at Clapham Methodist Church in Clapham Common. 
 It will take place every Friday morning term time. Please send me a message at catherine@thebrightdaycompany.net to reserve your space or visit www.thebrightdaycompany.net for more information. 

Hope to see you there!

name: LET'S START IN LONDON - Social events/friendly walks
description: Various friendly activities, many of them free, such as urban walks and get-together.  Members will meet like-minded people, have fun and socialise.

name: Life Drawing Windsor
description:
Welcome to Life Drawing Windsor.
This group is aimed at anyone with an interest in art and is keen on drawing or painting from life.

Expect updates on regular Life Drawing & Portrait sessions around Windsor. All levels are welcome and basic materials are provided.

Contact Russell with any enquiries:

russellflexman@hotmail\.co\.uk \| 07835381717 \| www\.russellflexman\.com/

name: Sketching Wild!
description:
This group is for anyone looking to deepen their understanding of sketching the natural world. If you are enthusiastic about wildlife and the natural world and want to meet other like-minded people, you are welcome to join. Once a month there is a regular evening class held at The American University on Richmond Hill. The classes will aim to develop your observational drawing skills with a combination of learning and looking. Each class will start with a presentation, from comparative anatomy of quadrupedal mammals to the symmetry of flowers. These presentations with fun interactive activities will deepen your knowledge of the underlying structures found in the natural world. Each class will introduce students to unique adaptations found in the diverse range of species we share the earth with.

The second part of the class will be a practical session. As the seasons change, Richmond’ Park seasonal fauna will provide first hand observational material to work from. Towards the summer, we will be venturing out into the Park and sketching the views from Richmond Hill. These classes are for all abilities, from beginner to proficient artist.

There will also be free weekend meetups, such as sketching at zoos, museums, farms and London’s parks.

Other links: http://www.timpond.co.uk/

twitter: https://twitter.com/timothypond

We now have a facebook page where you can post your artwork! Please join the group!

https://www.facebook.com/groups/322361228114784/

name: Literary London Walking Tours
description:
I am a literary scholar and historian with a special interest in the London contexts of literature. Join me for guided walks to find out more about the city's rich literary history!

These walks represent an excellent opportunity to apprehend the rich historical and cultural significance of the streets we walk every day. You will see hidden and little known public spaces that shaped the works of our greatest writers.

Our first walking tour is Discover Shakespeare's London, which will show you how the buildings, spaces and people of London found their way into Shakespeare's famous works and shaped his plays. This tour will give you a deeper understanding of Shakespeare, his works, and the world around him at the start of the seventeenth century.

I can help you discover Shakespeare's London at first hand, including hidden historical gems that you will not find in guide books.

name: -PAINT & SiP Social-
description:
A Fun group for males and females for fun urban nights out and day time events. <br> No experience necessary ☺️

We will be meeting up socially for fun sip and paint events!

If you have never been to a Sip and Paint event before below is a little snippet of what to expect.

Your friendly host will greet you at the event, interdudcing you to other members. This means you can always attend alone. You will be seated, all your art supplies will be placed at you table setting. You are free to paint what ever you want as this is a free style event.

Order your drinks or food and you are good to go, we will have background music playing a mix of genras.

*(25 years plus pls)*

All you need to do is sip paint and enjoy, and make new friends!

You will have to purchase your Sip n paint ticket before the event, as no sales on the day. A link will be posted on the site.

PLEASE ONLY RSVP if you have bought a ticket for an event

Please don't waste organisations time by rsvp ING then not turning up or buying a ticket. You will be removed from the group

A Meetup fee for each event , that is paid on the day is £2, to help with running cost of the group.

Hope to see you soon !

name: Let's Discover London, Virtually
description:
Welcome to Let's Discover London! 


We've been giving guided tours of London to thousands of people since 2006 and since lockdown started, we also give virtual tours..


our virtual tours are interactive, fun, accessible and live-streamed, so you can see images, old paintings and street views of Google earth to really make the experience come alive.


You don't need any prior knowledge of London's history to enjoy them and if you want to switch your video off, that's fine too. Just sit back enjoy the ride.


My name's Loona and I'm the lead guide at Let's Discover London. I was trained by and gave official tours at the British Museum, set up and narrated the audio guides at the Genocide Museum in Rwanda and have appeared on several TV documentaries (Urban Secrets Sky Atlantic, The Repair Shop, BBC1 and The Hairy Builder BBC2). I hold an economics degree from the University of Cambridge.


For for more information and for my reviews please see my website www.letsdiscoverlondon.com


Thanks, stay safe and I hope to see you soon.

Loona

name: Reading Freelancers and Creatives
description:
A group for the freelancers, the self employed and the creative. It'd be glorious to bounce ideas, collaborate.... and remember what it's like to talk to another human being......the way you did before you became self employed. Fight the inner hermit! We are based at The Curious Lounge in Reading

All are welcome, whether you work from home/ are self employed and just really need to have some sort of conversation with someone before you forget how, or are a local creative; artists, stylists, photographers, designers, makeup artists, videographers, journalists, writers/bloggers- whatever you may be. It's great to get lots of creative minds in one place to brainstorm and plan a revolution.

name: Life Drawing in E11
description:
Experience life drawing in a relaxed and friendly environment.
With inspiring poses by professional models.
Tutored under my guidance or explore your own creativity.
All abilities welcome.

Class will start on the first Wednesday in July. 7.30pm to 9.30pm .Will not run in August. Will resume in September to the end of the year.

name: Richmond Art & Creativity Meetup
description:
This is a group for anyone who would like to explore their creativity. Exploring drawing, painting, making collages and mosaics. Friendly and relaxed art workshops led by Kate and Ruth, both trained artists 

Follow us on Instagram at 

richmondartandcreativity

name: DRAWING MUSIC and VIBES Thursday Life Drawing in East London
description:
DRAWING, MUSIC and VIBES!!
Join a friendly live life drawing session in Bethnal Green, London, with professional models run by artist Tammy Weiss.

name: Brighton Adult Drama Classes with Savage Heart Theatre Co
description:
Hello! We are Savage Heart, a Brighton based theatre company running drama classes and workshops for adults of all ages (18+) and levels of experience. Join this meetup group to find out about our regular courses and 'Taster Sessions.' Our classes are run by theatre director Joy Forsythe and writer/performer Rachel Mae Brady. We have years of experience running workshops and creating safe spaces for participants to express their creativity.

In 'Beginners' Drama' we play drama games, learn acting technique and get creative with character and script work. If you’ve been struggling with group interaction as we return to ‘normal life’, this course can help ease you back in to social settings. Emphasis is on confidence building and having fun.

In 'Intermediate Drama' we delve further into the world of performing. This course offers a more in depth look at acting technique in a welcoming and fun environment.

name: London Creativity Coaching Conversations
description:
My name is Vernon.  I am a creativity coach.  Most people don't know what creativity coaching is but it's a powerful, life changing way of getting clear and creating the life you want.  If you want to change something in your life and you can see having someone support you through that then coaching conversations are the best way to achieve that. 

Very often the work I do helps people to realise a creative ambition that they wish to fulfil. It could be writing, painting, singing, photography or any other creative project. 

In between developing my coaching practice (limited number of committed clients) and completing my first book I like to offer people the opportunity to have a discovery coaching conversation with me at an agreed location face to face or via Skype to help people work through any blocks or challenges or fears they have.  If you lack confidence or clarity then this might just be the group for you.    

I will also be running a few co-coaching workshops where people will learn a fun and simple way to coach others.  You will love this.

For those not yet ready to talk I will also be available to offer a select few some support via email. 

See you soon!  

Vernon James

www.thecasualartist.co.uk  

ps.  To learn more about the work I do you can see a grainy video with clear audio right here!  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HZ_VoH3QEx4

name: Drawing values - London tutored draw and paint studio
description:
Art classes focused on figurative and abstract drawing and painting. Addressed to beginners, intermediate or advanced adult learners.
Art classes focused on figurative and abstract drawing and painting. Addressed to beginners, intermediates and advanced learners who would like a taste of a different approach.
The goal of these classes is to introduce the student to the fundamentals of painting and drawing. It's more possible to express ourselves successfully when we understand how a visual language is structured.
Classes consist of studies on still life and nude human compositions. Media to be used are charcoal, pencil, acrylics, ink, and watercolours.

Location: Tannery Arts studios, 15-19 Parkhouse St. Camberwell, London SE5 7TQ
*Tannery Arts has no affiliation with these classes and is not responsible for their content.*

name: Creative Thinking and Collaboration using Improv (Virtual).
description:
Become more creative, agile and collaborative - achieve more at work and home. 


What we're about

Want to think of new possibilities? Be more collaborative at work? Make decisions quicker?


More about Improv 

Improvisation, or ‘improv’, is a form of group activity in which exercises games and stories are made up spontaneously. There are no lines to rehearse and is highly creative and fun. Improv offers amazing opportunities for problem solving, innovation and creativity both for home and at work.

Improvisation, or ‘improv’, is well-regarded for unlocking creativity that has been used for over 50 years. Creativity is an innate part in every human and improv helps you discover and unlock this magic.

Studies have shown that the skills of improvisation can help with better management of unexpected changes and uncertainty. It improves collaboration, builds confidence, and increases the ability to absorb new ideas. It is highly recommended for creativity. We use a variety of virtual games as a way of being creative. 

You will need some experience of understanding of improv to join. You will need to come with an open mind.



Create together. Be spontaneous. Laugh - What people say about our improv :

“Was warmly welcomed and felt at ease straight away, with such a lovely group of people.”

“The Improv Class was amazing and fun”

“Great to meet new people; enjoyed all games.”

Our ground rules will be:

• Be Spontaneous

• Making mistakes is OK (and where learning and creativity happens)

• Go with the Flow - Say “Yes and….”

• Respect other people’s boundaries

• Be prepared for spontaneity, silliness and laughter

You will need to be come with an open mind. We operate a pay-as-you feel model.


Our Code of Behaviour


Improv is about respecting your scene partner(s) and the group. A safe environment is our primary concern.


• If you are abusive in any way you will be asked to leave


• We ask there is no consumption of alcohol before and during the virtual class


• While improv generates interesting characters and creates unique scenes, it should never be used as a veil to abuse others or deliberately put anyone in an upsetting situation.


About the Facilitator

Ketan Varia works for Kinetik Solutions and has run regular improv drop-in's in London over the last 2 years. He is also active in Applied Improvisation. His background includes 20 years of experience in helping organisations and individuals work better with change.

Your Questions

Who is this event for?

If you want to be more creative in your thinking and attitude, then this is the event for you. This session will help you become more spontaneous, create more options and become more flexible in your thinking, helping you connect better with people of all ages and backgrounds.

What software do I need to join?

We use Zoom.us as our technology. You will be sent a joining link after registration. You will need to have your video on to take part. Ideally use a computer but a tablet device will also work. If you can, avoid using a mobile phone.

What's the cost?

Our classes are not free. We run our classes on a professional basis. However, we operate a pay-as-you-feel. After the event, you can reflect about the value it delivered to you and pay accordingly for each class you attend via secure payment to Kinetik Solutions (the organiser): https://swoof.ee/sjneh

How do I find out my local time for London time 5pm?

You can use this converter

https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/converter.html?iso=20200405T160000&p1=136

Do you deliver Improv to organisation or provided tailored services?

Yes we deliver to organisations of all types. Contact us at http://www.kinetik.uk.com and https://www.kinetik.uk.com/products/improv-business/ . We also can provide individual coaching in creativity and critical thinking.

name: Art Battle London
description:
Hi! My name is Alice, and I run 2 Art Events in Camden (London, UK): Art Battle London and Death Drawing London.

Art Battle London is the official London branch of the international Art Battle Tournament!
Watch as artists transform blank canvases into beautiful pieces of art in just 20 minutes, and then help vote to determine the winner of the event! All artwork will also be available for the silent auction.
Be a part of the fun as a spectator, or participate as one of the featured artists by applying online at https://linktr.ee/artbattlelondon

Death Drawing London is life drawing, but make it Goth! for anyone who wants to discover the inner artist within them and unleash their creativity over a few drinks and an award-winning pizza. The sessions have a gothic edge and a kick-ass playlist.
\- A friendly local artist will teach you how to create your masterpiece\.
\- No previous experience is required \- complete beginners are also welcome\!
\- one drink\, one pizza\, and all materials required are included in the ticket price\.
Tickets on:
www.designmynight.com/london/restaurants/camden/lost-boys-pizza/d-e-a-t-h-d-r-a-w-i-n-g

Have fun and see you there!

name: Amateur Drama Classes
description:
This is an Amateur Drama Class that takes place every Friday morning from 10 am to 11:30 am at Clapham Methodist Church.

Acting exercises include (but are not limited to): relaxation, improvisations, games, storytelling, and text work (a bit later on). Aside from learning more about acting, these exercises provide wonderful tools to build confidence, get more comfortable with public speaking and interactions, and connect to yourself and others. And it’s fun too!

My name is Catherine and I have been acting for the last 20 years and teaching in various drama schools for the last 10 years. I hold an MA in Actor Training and Coaching (teaching Acting) from the Royal Central School of Drama.

The session starts at 10:00 am and finishes at 11:30 am on Fridays. The trial session is 10 pounds and should be paid before class in order to reserve your spot. Different payment options are available if you do decide to come back.

The class is held in a hall at Clapham Methodist Church (entrance on Nelsons Row). It's the last door on the left (at the end of the rail). There will be a sign on the door.

For the last term of class, we will be working on scenes that we will showcase for friends and family on the evening of the 6th of July at the Omnibus Theatre. 

It will take place every Friday morning during the term. Please send me a message at catherine@[thebrightdaycompany.net](http://thebrightdaycompany.net) to reserve your space or visit [www.thebrightdaycompany.net](http://www.thebrightdaycompany.net) for more information. If you do reserve on Meetup, please make sure you attend the session or cancel if you can make it as it will allow people on the wait list to join. Thank you!

Hope to see you there!

name: Living Room London Arts
description: Art is the expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form such as painting or sculpture, producing works to be appreciated primarily for their beauty or emotional power. We wanna nurture and encourage our community to develop in all arts and expressions of the soul!

name: Mindset Salon: Mindful & Curious Empaths and HSPs
description:
Welcome to the ‘Mindset Salon: Mindful & Curious Empaths and HSPs’ group!


Do you remember the feeling when you found out that you are an Empath, or a Highly Sensitive Person or maybe both? Maybe you ‘accidentally’ came across a book, an article or maybe you took one of these tests:


https://drjudithorloff.com/quizzes/empath-self-assessment-test/


http://hsperson.com/test/highly-sensitive-test/


You felt a sudden relief mixed with the realisation that you are not alone. Oh, the pure joy of it!


The next thing you thought: How do I meet fellow Empaths or Highly Sensitives? Where can we socialise? You crave deep discussions, arts and culture and you are always curios and want to learn more.


The ‘Mindset Salon: Mindful & Curious Empaths and HSPs’ group is a safe place to express yourself and your ideas while meeting with fellow kind, joyful and creative Empaths and Highly Sensitives.


This group is focusing on the following topics:


Intuitive coaching and mentoring: Holistic coaching using positive psychology, mindfulness and traditional coaching techniques from a trained, professional coach. The sessions are taking place in person or online, in a small group setting or one-to-one format.


Intuitive Reading & Energy Healing: Most Empaths and Sensitives are very spiritual but sometimes their energies are unbalanced due to them being unaware that they are taking on other people's energies. With the help of a trained Energy Healer, these unwanted energies can be effectively removed.


Empaths and HSPs are craving real connections and meaningful discussions. Due to the pandemic we had to take a break, but hopefully we'll have the chance to meet up soon socially too.


The type of social events this group offers from the new year are:


Informal discussions: We’ll go to a restaurant or a pub and have a laid-back discussion on Life as curious and creative Empath and HSP. Each event will focus on a different topic.



Art & Culture Social: We'll immerse ourselves in London's superb arts and cultural life; we’ll go to a museum, art gallery or see a new show together and network afterwards.


Hope to see you soon!

name: China Britain Art Centre - based in Oxford
description: This is a group for people who are interested in Chinese arts, culture and language. We are a group of artisits who are dedicated to promote the UK-China art culture exchange. We will meet once a week for various workshops such as Guzheng (古筝）- a traditional Chinese musical instrument, Chinese classical dancing, Chinese calligraphy, Chinese brush painting and Chinese language. We can also meet at all the events we hold such as Sino-British concert, art work exhibitions, and so on. We bring Chinese students to Oxford every year to experience a totally different summer and winter holidays, and we also bring people who are interested in Chinese culture to China for art exchange. Come and join us if you have any interest in any of the Chinese arts and cultures. Looking forward to meet other art enthusiasts!

name: Barkingside Art Club
description:
Bringing the community together through visual art and inclusion. 

Barkingside Art Club (BAC) is a fantastic organisation which provides the local schools and community with a plethora of diverse, enriching projects. Our sole mantra is; 

"Creativity is the power to connect the seemingly unconnected" 

Our slogan which is clearly evident through the consistent projects we undertake. 

 BAC is a relatively new collective which first formed in the Summer of 2017. The team itself embraces a vast range of practising freelance artists, with differing skills and art history knowledge. BAC aims to provide a platform to realize and visually express, via an array of mediums. 

The services we offer the compromise of various workshops for both children and adults from all backgrounds and abilities; to print-making, portraiture, and painting amongst many others. Right through to larger, more pronounced ventures such as The Big Draw and Lumiere London Festival, we are currently working with the Redbridge Culture Team, and have many more exciting events pending such as Paint in the Park at Fairlop Fair. 

Our key aim is to create countless exciting and lively events suitable for all types of individuals! 

Another key belief in BAC’s manifesto is; 

"Our artistic approach to teaching and learning is focussed on using art for a good cause", 

This can constantly be seen through our involvement with SEN (special needs) children. The utilisation of 'art' as a therapy is an unchanging ideology applied throughout BAC; any individual from any walk of life can appreciate the many aesthetics found in art as a subject. 
  Overall the projects, our avant-garde enterprise undertakes is immensely beneficial and necessary to the community and schools. As it aids the creative minds of all diversities and ages, to understand the expression within the art. As well as the image surrounding the infinite possibilities within the 'art' genre.

name: Wycombe Arts Festival
description:
Anyone interested in attending Arts Festival events, helping out, venues, artists</p>

History of the festival

The Wycombe Arts Festival was started 50 years ago. It is a registered charity, and is a non-profitmaking organisation. We solely rely on sponsorship from local people and organisations (these are credited where applicable in the programme). We also have a number of regular Patrons, (see list elsewhere on the website), who pay a minimum subscription - currently £24 - each year. Obviously, without this support, we would not be able to provide such a variety of events, so we would like to repeat our thanks to these organisations and individuals.

The Festival is organised entirely by volunteers, who work hard throughout the year to arrange a mixture of events across the artistic spectrum for our local community.


About Wycombe Arts Festival       

Booking Hotline: 01628 483597 
Focused in and around High Wycombe and Marlow in the South of Buckinghamshire within the Chiltern Hills, the festival offers a wide range of the arts, both amateur and professional. 
Its aim is to embrace and engage all members of the community.

2014 marked the festival's 50th anniversary.  Each year, the festival includes a wide range of musical events including jazz, chamber and orchestral concerts, photographic and art exhibitions, theatre productions, National Trust walks, storytelling and talks on subjects of local interest and much, much more.

This large range of events reinforces the aim of the festival to bring a wide variety of performing and visual arts to the widest possible audience at a reasonable cost.

name: Bulgarian Cultural Institute London
description:
If you have already fallen in love with Bulgaria and its culture, or you're just curious and browsing, then this is the place to be! The home of the cultural scene for all things related to Bulgaria.

The Bulgarian Cultural Institute London aims to promote, support and develop cultural relations between Bulgaria and the UK through various means:

Introduce Bulgarian culture to the UK’s international audience through exhibitions, performances, concerts, film screenings, theatrical productions, recitals, literary evenings, discussions and other events.

Organise a multitude of interesting courses and seminars, as well as Bulgarian traditions and crafts evenings and workshops.

Collaborate with, support and partner with other similar institutions, Anglo-Bulgarian associations and other cultural representatives.

Offer a library and reading room with a wide selection of Bulgarian and foreign literature, albums, films, dictionaries, guides and other materials.

name: Creative Richmond - Business training and networking
description:
Looking to start-up or grow your creative business? Join this group for networking opportunities, business and marketing training and so much more.


Richmond has many strengths that make it a perfect base for the creative industry sector, including: publishing, motion picture/film/radio/video production and distribution, advertising, photography, architecture, and software consultancy. The cultural and physical heritage of the borough means that it is regularly used by film location companies. Covid-19 has had a devastating impact on many creatives in the borough where work has dried up and many haven’t qualified for financial support. This group is set up to bring creatives together, to work with each other and to help everyone get through this crisis. We hold a range of online events focusing on the support people need to grow their leads and business. Members can also gain access to one to one mentoring support to work on key challenges for growth.
